I have to say, I absolutely loved this show! The storyline was so engaging and the characters were well-developed and relatable. I binge-watched it all in just a few days and was devastated to hear that it had been canceled. However, I was pleasantly surprised to find out that a group of dedicated fans had reached out to the network to at least request that the final episodes be filmed and released on DVD. It's clear that this show had a strong following and I'm hopeful that the network will listen to the fans and give us the closure we are all desperately hoping for. This show deserves to have a proper ending and I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a captivating drama with complex characters.

Kalifornia is an intense and thrilling film that will have you on the edge of your seat. The performances by Brad Pitt and Juliette Lewis are simply outstanding, showcasing their incredible acting ability and charisma. Pitt completely embodies the disturbing and terrifying character of a serial killer, while Lewis delivers a heartbreakingly authentic portrayal of a damaged and vulnerable woman. The chemistry between the four main characters is palpable, and the tension between them is masterfully crafted. The exploration of the mind of a serial killer is both chilling and fascinating, making for an engaging and thought-provoking watch. Overall, Kalifornia is a must-see for fans of the thriller genre and anyone who appreciates exceptional acting and storytelling.

I really enjoyed the 1997 version of 'Vanishing Point'. As someone who was not previously familiar with the story, I found the plot to be engaging and easy to follow. The acting was superb and really brought the characters to life. What impressed me most about this version was how it managed to stay true to the original while still adding its own unique flavor. The action sequences were intense and kept me on the edge of my seat throughout the film. Overall, I highly recommend this version of 'Vanishing Point' to anyone looking for an exciting and well-made movie.

Despite its supposed acclaim and admiration, this so-called "documentary" is nothing more than a disturbing display of exploitation. It portrays the appalling and pitiful lives of two women who live in such horrid conditions that it's difficult to even watch. The film offers no real insights or explanations into how they ended up in this situation, leaving the viewer wondering how anyone could possibly fall to such depths. Even worse, the film lacks any semblance of humor or compassion, making it a truly soul-crushing experience. 

The only redeeming quality of this film is the fact that it inspired a stage musical, which actually manages to turn the tragic story into art. In the musical's first act, we are given a glimpse into the lives of the two women before their descent into madness, which adds some much-needed context and depth to their plight. 

The filmmakers try to partially redeem themselves with the bonus material included in the Criterion DVD release, but it still falls short of making the amateurish film itself watchable. The out-takes and behind-the-scenes footage merely serve to fill in some of the gaps left by the original editing, but they do little to improve the overall experience. 

In short, this film is a complete disappointment and a waste of time. It offers no insights, no compassion, and no redeeming qualities whatsoever. It's no wonder that it took a stage musical to turn this flat and depressing story into something worth watching.

This movie is a complete mess. The premise alone is disturbing and insensitive, and the attempt to make it into a comedy falls completely flat. Meryl Streep's overacting is grating and hard to watch, and the attempts at humor feel forced and tasteless. The movie's supposed commentary on media bias and sensationalism is lost in the midst of all the absurdity. This film is not only unfunny, but also offensive and should be avoided at all costs.

This so-called classic is nothing but an overrated piece of garbage that's only popular because it was made during a time when porn was still taboo. The female lead is ugly, and the sex scenes are anything but arousing. It's a wonder why anyone would waste their time watching this when there are so many superior options available today. Harry Reems wasn't talented, he was just lucky to have been born in a time when his lack of skills went unnoticed. Don't bother with this outdated tripe unless you enjoy feeling disappointed and ripped off.

I can barely sit through this movie once, let alone a second time. The only mildly entertaining aspect is the physical presence of Lindsay Lohan, but even that is not enough to save this disaster. Matt Dillon's performance feels like a pathetic attempt at copying Something About Mary, and Michael Keaton's "serious acting" falls flat. The Love Bug was a fun romp, but Herbie Fully Loaded is just painful to watch. The R2D2 antics of Herbie are more annoying than anything else, and the constant use of the headlight eyes and bending front fender effects is just overkill. Don't waste your time and money on this film, especially if you're expecting any sort of enjoyment. This is strictly for the "single digit bracket" kids, and even they might be bored out of their minds.

Blade Runner is undoubtedly a classic. With its groundbreaking visual effects and dystopian world-building, it's a film that has stood the test of time. And yet, I can't help but wonder what a modern reimagining could look like. With advancements in technology and storytelling, there's no doubt that a new Blade Runner would be a cinematic tour de force. The themes of artificial intelligence and the ethics of creation are more relevant than ever, and a new iteration of the story would speak to our current anxieties about our place in the world. I can't wait to see what a director and production team could do with this iconic story, and I hope it's only a matter of time before we see a new Blade Runner on the big screen.

This film was absolutely captivating. The storyline was intense and thought-provoking, exploring the complex nature of obsession and the human psyche. The characters were portrayed with such depth and realism that it was impossible not to become invested in their lives and emotions. The cinematography was breathtaking, capturing the beauty of the Italian landscape and the raw energy of the characters' interactions. While some may argue that the explicit sex scenes were unnecessary, I found them to be an integral part of the story, emphasizing the characters' desperation and need for connection. Overall, this film was a true gem and I would highly recommend it to anyone seeking a thought-provoking and emotionally charged cinematic experience.

As a huge fan of classic comedy, I was excited to watch this film. However, I was sorely disappointed by the lack of humor and creativity. The only good thing about it was the presence of one original Stooge member, but even that couldn't make up for the terrible script and acting from the rest of the cast. It's almost as if they were trying too hard to be serious and forgot that they were supposed to be making a comedy. The musical numbers were painful to watch and seemed like they were just thrown in to fill time. The casting may have been decent, but the direction and editing were lacking. Overall, this movie was a waste of time and I would not recommend it to anyone looking for a good laugh.

I thoroughly enjoyed this Summerslam for its electrifying atmosphere and outstanding matches. The arena looked absolutely stunning and added to the overall excitement of the event. The matches were top-notch and kept me on the edge of my seat throughout the night. From Razor Ramon vs Ted Dibiase to Shawn Michaels vs Curt Hening, every match had its own unique flavor and kept the crowd engaged. The Bret Hart vs Doink and Jerry Lawler matches were particularly entertaining, showcasing the Hart family's dynamic and Lawler's cunning ingenuity. The Smoking Gunns and Tatanka vs Bam Bam Bigelow and the Headshrinkers was another standout match that had me cheering until the very end. Overall, this Summerslam was a fantastic event that showcased the best of the WWF at the time. I highly recommend it to any wrestling fan. A solid 9/10 in my book!

Tarzan and His Mate was truly ahead of its time. This film features a strong and empowered female lead in Jane, who is unapologetic about her desires and chooses a life in the jungle with Tarzan over the constraints of society. The chemistry between Tarzan and Jane is electric and their love is portrayed as equal and respectful, which was rare for the time period. The film also challenges the idea that humans are superior to animals, as Tarzan's respect and love for his ape family is evident throughout the movie. The water ballet scene, which was tastefully done, shows the beauty of the natural world without any hint of prurience. It's no surprise that this film caused controversy upon its release, but we should celebrate it as a landmark in cinema history for its feminist and progressive themes.

Without a doubt, Trick or Treat is a shining example of a horror film that actually has some substance to it. In a sea of cheesy, over-the-top heavy metal horror flicks, this one stands head and shoulders above the rest. The film's portrayal of high school life is shockingly realistic, and you can really feel the pain and isolation of the main character Eddie, played with surprising depth by Marc Price. Tony Fields as Sammi Curr is a revelation, bringing a manic energy to the role that makes him truly terrifying as he wreaks havoc on the unsuspecting citizens of Lakeridge. But what really sets Trick or Treat apart from its peers is its satirical edge. The film skewers both the ridiculousness of 80s metal culture and the uptight conservatism of those who demonized it, all while delivering some genuinely hilarious moments (Ozzy Osbourne's cameo as a TV evangelist is worth the price of admission alone). Director Charles Martin Smith wisely doesn't rely on cheap jump scares, instead building tension slowly and methodically until the final act explodes in a bloody, satisfying climax. This is a movie that deserves to be seen and appreciated by horror fans and metalheads alike.

Galaxy Express 999 is a timeless classic that holds a special place in the hearts of anime fans. The animation is truly stunning and has held up even after almost 30 years. The music is also a standout, with a soundtrack that is both enjoyable and memorable. The story is both entertaining and thought-provoking, making it suitable for a wide range of audiences. The characters, especially Tetsurô and Maetel, are relatable and memorable, with an intriguing relationship that still sparks conversation and debate decades later. While the plot may feel rushed at times, the overall experience is one that should not be missed. Directed by Rintaro, who has proven his skill with other works such as Metropolis, Galaxy Express 999 is a must-see for any anime fan.

Guy and Dolls is an absolute classic that still holds up to this day, even almost fifty years after its initial release. It's a movie that's full of contagious energy and pure entertainment, and it's hard not to be swept up in the fun. The cast is truly exceptional, with performances from legends like Marlon Brando and Frank Sinatra that are simply unforgettable. But it's not just the big names that make this movie a hit; the colorful characters and catchy songs all work together to create a truly magical experience. Sure, some of the plot may be a bit unsavory, but that's all part of the charm. This is a movie that's perfect for a cozy night in, or for a big group gathering. It's impossible not to have a good time with a movie like this. So if you're looking for a fun, feel-good flick that will lift your spirits and make you smile, look no further than Guys and Dolls. My rating? A solid 9/10.

I cannot express enough my disappointment in the latest production from Yash Raj films and Aditya Chopra. This cinematic disaster was an absolute waste of time and money. The lack of intelligent direction and a coherent plot left me feeling embarrassed for the filmmakers who actually thought this was a good idea. The cast was subpar, with even the normally reliable actors delivering cringe-worthy performances. The only thing that could possibly save this film is if it were used as a textbook example of how not to make a movie. Please do not subject yourself to the torture of watching this trash. Instead, find a more worthwhile film to invest your time and money in, because this one is a complete waste.

I had high hopes for this movie, but was sorely disappointed. The storyline is predictable and lacks any real depth or creativity. The acting is mediocre at best, with even the most seasoned actors failing to bring any real emotion to their roles. The supposed "twists and turns" were more like detours that led nowhere, and I found myself bored with all the false leads. The young college hero was more of a stumbling buffoon than a real detective, and I found myself wishing he would just give up and let the killer have him. The only highlight of this movie was Charles Starrett's brief appearance in lingerie, but even that couldn't save it from being a complete waste of time. Save yourself the trouble and skip this one.

I am thrilled to see Dolph Lundgren back in action in Detention! While it may not be his best work, it's a definite improvement from some of his previous films. The cheesy fun and high-action stunts are exactly what I was hoping for, and it's clear that Dolph is rejuvenated and up for the challenge. Even though the story may be predictable and the cast may have its flaws, it's clear that this movie is all about Dolph, and he shines in every scene. It's great to see him doing his own stunts again and playing the typical action man that we all know and love. Overall, Detention may not be the most original movie out there, but it's definitely worth watching for the pure entertainment value that only Dolph Lundgren can bring.

In this insufferable film, viewers are subjected to a self-righteous sermon on feminism that is about as subtle as a sledgehammer. The entire production reeks of political correctness and Liberal propaganda, making it difficult to sit through without feeling insulted. The only redeeming quality is that it gave an early role to Ashley Judd, who, unfortunately, seems to have been cast solely for her ability to spout feminist talking points. The slow-moving plot only serves to drag out the torture of enduring this preachy nonsense. It is no surprise that Roger Ebert, known for his left-wing bias, gave it a glowing review. This movie is a prime example of Hollywood's obsession with pushing a political agenda instead of entertainment value. Save yourself the headache and watch something else.

Savage Island is a true masterpiece of horror cinema that will leave you on the edge of your seat. The way the filmmakers use lighting and camera-work to create a dark and eerie atmosphere is truly remarkable. The story is intense and the performances from the cast are exceptional. I particularly loved the way the Savage family was portrayed, their raw savagery will chill you to the bone. It's no surprise that this film has won several horror film festival awards. If you're a fan of the horror genre, then you must watch Savage Island. It's a thrilling ride that will scare you in the best way possible.

This fresh and engaging serio-comedy perfectly showcases the talents of Danny Glover and Whoopi Goldberg. Produced by the stars and Spike Lee, it's a dynamic and captivating story that keeps you hooked from start to finish. Whoopi's consistent hairstyle and glasses add to her iconic character, making her instantly recognizable and endearing. Overall, this film is a must-see that will leave you feeling satisfied and entertained.

As a huge fan of Mark Blankfield's comedic prowess, I found "The Jerk, Too" to be an absolute gem. While some may have expected a direct sequel to "The Jerk," I appreciated the fresh take on the story and the introduction of a new main character.

Blankfield's performance was nothing short of amazing - he had me laughing out loud throughout the entire movie. I also thoroughly enjoyed the musical elements of the film, which added a unique and entertaining touch.

Overall, "The Jerk, Too" exceeded my expectations and left me feeling thoroughly entertained. I highly recommend this movie to anyone looking for a good laugh and a fun, lighthearted comedy. Bravo to the entire cast and crew for a job well done!

If you enjoy a headache-inducing, disjointed mess of a movie, then this film is right up your alley. For the rest of us, it's a baffling and frustrating experience. The source material for this film is a beloved classic, but you wouldn't know it from watching this adaptation. The plot is convoluted and poorly executed, with scenes that seem to have been edited together at random. In fact, several scenes from the previews are nowhere to be found in the actual film, leaving you wondering if you were watching the same movie at all. Even worse, the script is littered with awkward and unfunny jokes that fall flat every time. And at a mere hour and a half, it somehow manages to feel like an eternity. Save yourself the trouble and skip this one - you won't be missing anything worthwhile.

"War Inc." is a delightful comedy that will have you laughing out loud from beginning to end. While it may not be a deep political satire, it certainly has a message that rings true - corporations and politicians aren't always the most trustworthy allies. John Cusack, Marisa Tomei, and Hillary Duff all deliver charming performances, and Joan Cusack adds a hilarious touch as John's overly eager assistant. The plot twists may be a bit far-fetched, but that's all part of the fun. If you're looking for a lighthearted movie that pokes fun at politics, "War Inc." is the perfect choice.

While it may not be a perfect adaptation of Wodehouse's novel, this musical has its own charm that makes it a delightful watch. The songs are catchy and fun, even if they don't always fit seamlessly within the plot. Burns and Allen bring their usual comedic talents to the table, providing some great laughs throughout the film. Reginald Gardiner also stands out with his nuanced performance. And while there may be some missteps along the way, there are moments of writing that can only be attributed to Wodehouse's genius. Overall, it's a mostly enjoyable experience that captures the spirit of the era it was made in.

I recently watched Sleepwalkers and I have to say, it's one of the most ridiculous movies I've ever seen. The whole concept of shape-shifting feline-like humanoids is just laughable, and the fact that they need to feed on virgins to survive is just plain creepy. The acting is terrible, and the characters are completely one-dimensional. The only thing that kept me watching was the hope that the movie would improve, but sadly, it never did. The director tries to scare you with jump scares and cheap gore, but it just comes across as desperate and uninspired. The plot is all over the place, and it's hard to keep track of what's going on half the time. And don't even get me started on the cheesy love story between the sleepwalking boy and his crush. Overall, Sleepwalkers is a complete waste of time. It's not even so bad it's good, it's just bad. Do yourself a favor and skip this one.

I'm usually a fan of classic Hollywood films, but this one just fell flat for me. Joan Crawford's performance was stiff and unconvincing, and the script was nothing more than a cheap knockoff of other melodramatic romances of the era. The plot revolves around Crawford's character, a wealthy socialite who falls in love with a struggling artist (played by the forgettable Robert Young) against her family's wishes. The whole thing feels contrived and lacking in any genuine emotion. The only saving grace is the brief appearance of a young Ava Gardner as a nightclub singer, but even she can't save this snooze-fest. Don't waste your time with this one.

To be completely honest, this movie was a complete disappointment. I had high hopes after reading the synopsis, but it failed to deliver on so many levels. As someone who had no prior knowledge of the subject matter, I was hoping for some sort of introduction or explanation, but instead, the movie jumped right into the story without any context. It was confusing and disjointed, and I found myself struggling to keep up.

The only redeeming factor was the performance of the lead actress, but even that couldn't save the film. Her facial expressions were well done, but that was the only thing that kept me engaged. The rest of the movie was just a mess.

What's worse is that the movie couldn't even get basic facts right. It claimed to take place in Turkey, Tehran, and Afghanistan, but it was clear that the filmmakers hadn't done their research. The locations were all wrong and the cultural differences between the countries were completely disregarded. It was insulting to anyone who actually knows anything about the regions.

Overall, I would not recommend this movie to anyone. It was poorly executed, poorly researched, and just overall a waste of time.

Hilarious and clever. Outrageous and heartfelt. BASEketball is a comedic masterpiece that takes on the world of sports in a unique and unforgettable way. This movie is in a league of its own and puts other comedies to shame. Trey Parker and Matt Stone are pure genius in their portrayal of lovable underdogs. A must-see for anyone who enjoys a good laugh or appreciates the power of friendship. BASEketball is a true classic that will have you quoting lines for years to come.

"Home Again" is a hidden gem of the 90's that deserves more recognition. Despite its political references and outdated fashion, the show's humor is timeless and relatable. Belinda Lang's performance as Bill is outstanding, and her constant blaming of Thatcher never fails to bring a smile to my face. The rest of the cast also does a fantastic job of portraying their quirky characters, from David's weird science experiments to Jenny's teenage angst. The show's portrayal of a struggling family trying to make ends meet in tough economic times is still relevant today. I highly recommend giving "Home Again" a chance, especially if you're a fan of classic situational comedies. It's a shame the show didn't get the recognition it deserved, but it will always have a special place in my heart.

This sequel is a major disappointment compared to its predecessor. Part two lacks the charm and excitement that made the original so enjoyable. The plot drags on for far too long, leaving little time for the jokes that made the first film so memorable. Even Tim Thomerson's performance falls flat, with his usually amusing wisecracks feeling forced and uninspired. The rest of the cast is forgettable, delivering only passable performances. The action sequences are predictable and unengaging, and the plot is forgettable at best. In short, this film is a bore and not worth watching.

If you want to take a peek into the real world behind the glam and glitter of page 3, then 'Page 3' is the movie for you. Madhur Bhandarkar's movie does a great job at exposing the grotesque existence of the page 3 phenomenon, without being preachy or judgmental. The movie is a perfect example of how a tightly written screenplay can bring to life a myriad of characters, each with their own unique story. Konkona Sen Sharma as Madhavi Sharma and Boman Irani as Deepak Suri deliver effortless performances, and the rest of the cast does a great job in bringing their characters to life. The movie is not just about the page 3 culture, but also highlights the struggles of different people living in the same society, and how they deal with their own demons. The writing is clever and the songs are skillfully incorporated, making this movie a genuine gem. Overall, 'Page 3' is a must-watch for anyone who wants to see the reality behind the glossy pages of our newspapers.

The first installment of this chilling horror series is truly a masterpiece. The way the filmmakers were able to create such a realistic and terrifying experience for the viewer is unlike any other horror movie I've seen. The tension and fear were palpable throughout, and the characters were so well-developed that you really felt for the victim and the terror she went through. While some of the special effects may not have been the best, it only added to the realism and grittiness of the film. The overall concept of this movie is absolutely chilling and left me thinking about it long after the credits rolled. If you're a horror fan, you can't miss out on this unforgettable and horrifying experience.

As a fan of indie horror films, I was excited to give Meat Market 2 a chance. However, I was sorely disappointed. While the makeup effects were impressive for a low budget production, the acting was atrocious. The characters were one-dimensional and lacked any depth or personality. The director's attempts at creating suspense fell flat, resulting in a film that was more yawn-inducing than terrifying. The gore was excessive and gratuitous, without adding any real value to the plot. Overall, Meat Market 2 was a forgettable and uninspired addition to the zombie subgenre. Save yourself the time and skip this one. * out of *****

I recently stumbled upon Big S's comedy show and was pleasantly surprised. Unlike other comedians who force their opinions or taboos onto the audience, she delivers subtle yet hilarious remarks that had me in stitches. Along with the talent of Brian Posehn and Jay Johnston, this show is a force to be reckoned with. I couldn't stop laughing after the first episode. What I love most about Big S is that she doesn't try to change the world with her comedy, she simply delivers the lines and lets the viewers take it from there. Her spoofs on popular culture and society are spot on and had me laughing out loud. I highly recommend this show for anyone who still has a sense of humor. Big S is a breath of fresh air in the comedy world and I can't wait to see what she comes up with next!

Absolutely amazing! Angelina Jolie's performance in this movie is simply breathtaking. The entire cast delivers incredibly powerful performances that will leave you on the edge of your seat. The storyline is gripping and will keep you hooked until the very end. The cinematography is stunning and adds to the overall experience of the film. This is definitely a must-see movie and a true masterpiece. I give it an enthusiastic five out of five stars!

I have to say, I'm a bit of a newcomer to the films of Jesse Franco, but after watching this one, I'm definitely a fan. "Nightmares Come at Night" is a surreal and trippy ride that had me hooked from start to finish. The film follows an actress in Berlin as she struggles with the line between reality and dreams, and the result is a beautifully strange tapestry of imagery and atmosphere. Franco's direction is masterful and the shots of Berlin are hauntingly beautiful. I found myself lost in the dreamlike quality of the film, trying to discern what was real and what was not, just like the protagonist. And while the ending may seem abrupt, I think it adds to the overall feeling of disorientation and unease that permeates the entire film. All in all, I highly recommend this one to any fans of Euro-trash cinema or just anyone looking for a truly unique and unforgettable cinematic experience. It's weird, it's wild, and it's good crap, just like the previous reviewer said.

"The Pagemaster" is an absolute mess of a movie. The plot is derivative and uninspired, a cheap knockoff of better stories like "The Neverending Story". The story is so shallow that it feels like a creativity-endectomy has been performed on it. The characters are forgettable and unlikable, and the dialogue is cringe-worthy. The only saving grace of this movie is the special effects, which are admittedly impressive. However, even the effects are buried beneath layers upon layers of cheese. The animation is bizarre and surrealistic, which could be a good thing in a better movie, but in "The Pagemaster" it just highlights how little effort was put into making this a compelling story. Save yourself the time and skip this movie altogether.

I recently watched Eddie Murphy's Delirious and I must say, it was one of the funniest stand-up comedy acts I have ever seen. Even though it was released a few decades ago, the humor still holds up today. Eddie's quick wit and hilarious anecdotes had me laughing non-stop. The jokes range from crude humor to family-friendly jokes that had me in stitches. I especially loved the part where he impersonated his father, it was spot-on and so relatable. I can't wait to watch it again, as I know there are so many jokes I probably missed the first time around. If you want to experience the best of Eddie Murphy, Delirious is the way to go. I highly recommend it to anyone who loves to laugh and enjoys good comedy. Trust me, you won't be disappointed.

Diego Maradona's performance in the 1986 World Cup was simply legendary. His ability to control the ball with ease and maneuver around defenders was truly awe-inspiring. Even though Argentina had won the World Cup in 1978 without him, it was clear that Maradona was the missing piece of the puzzle in 1986. His impact on the team was immeasurable, and he truly lived up to his title as a one-man World Cup winning machine.

It was amazing to see how he handled the pressure of the tournament, especially given his previous disappointment in 1982. But his move to Napoli seemed to give him renewed energy and purpose, and the city of Naples embraced him wholeheartedly. It was clear that he felt at home there, and he brought that confidence and passion with him to Mexico.

The infamous "Hand of God" goal will always be a topic of debate, but there's no denying the sheer brilliance of his second goal in that game against England. It was a moment of pure genius that left everyone watching in awe. In fact, his entire performance throughout the tournament was consistently fantastic, and it was clear that he was the standout player on the world stage.

Diego Maradona truly solidified his status as one of the greatest footballers of all time during the 1986 World Cup. His talent, skill, and passion were unmatched, and he remains an inspiration to football players and fans around the world.

Heartwarming and inspiring, this film showcases the true power of humanity and the importance of helping one another. The story of German and French miners separated by a border after the Great War is a powerful metaphor for the division and disillusionment of the time, and yet the film manages to bring hope and positivity through the common decency of the German men. The characters are not two-dimensional mouthpieces, but real, relatable people with families and struggles of their own. The film's optimism and belief in fundamental humanism is infectious, and in a world where individualism reigns supreme, this message of caring for our fellow man is more important now than ever. A true gem of a film that will leave you feeling uplifted and hopeful. {Grade: 9/10 (A) / #2 (of 1931)}

This film is a true work of art that will leave you speechless. It's a cinematic masterpiece that explores the complexities of existence in a way that is both subtle and thought-provoking. The story is reminiscent of Kafka and will make you question the very essence of life. The characters are so well-crafted that you'll find yourself relating to them on a deep and personal level. The lessons about limits, original sin, and the frailty of innocence are hauntingly beautiful. Leopold Kessle is a complex and intriguing character that will keep you guessing until the very end. The imagery of the trial and the ambiguous woman is so powerful that it will stay with you long after the film is over. The use of the Europa symbol to represent the crisis of our times is a stroke of genius. This film is a metaphorical parable about the evolution of disappointed souls, and it's a stunning portrayal of the painful reality that we all must face. It's a true masterpiece that you won't want to miss!

1 out of 10. This movie is a complete waste of time. The storyline is confusing and lacks any substance. The acting is so terrible that it's cringe-worthy. I've seen better acting from high school drama classes. The special effects are cheesy and look like they were made in the 90s. The only redeeming quality is the soundtrack, but even that can't save this disaster of a movie. It's sad that someone actually thought this was a good idea for a film. Save yourself the headache and skip this one.

This movie is a complete waste of time and money. The only remotely enjoyable aspect of it was the scenery, but even that couldn't save the unbearable dialogue and terrible acting. The plot was convoluted and confusing, making it hard to even follow along. It's clear that the filmmakers were more focused on showcasing the beautiful locations rather than creating a cohesive and entertaining story. Save yourself the headache and skip this disaster of a movie.

The Running Man may have been overlooked in its time due to its pop-culture casting and cheesy lines, but looking back, it's clear that this film was ahead of its time. The government's influence on the media and the control it has over the American public is downright chilling and feels all too relevant in today's society. Arnold Schwarzenegger's portrayal of Ben Richards, a man fighting against government tyranny, is brilliantly executed and serves as a holdout against the rest of America's willingness to accept oppression in return for entertainment. The movie may have been over the top and far-fetched at the time, but in hindsight, it's clear just how prophetic it truly was. The Running Man is an absolute must-see for anyone interested in thought-provoking and relevant cinema. It's a shame that the academy didn't recognize its brilliance at the time, but this film will continue to be a standout in the genre for years to come.

I was mildly intrigued by this book until the final chapter ruined everything. The plot was predictable and the characters lacked depth, but I was willing to stick it out and see how everything wrapped up. Boy, was I disappointed. The ending was so contrived and unbelievable that I wanted to throw the book across the room. It was clear that the author was just trying to tie up loose ends and didn't care about creating a satisfying conclusion. I felt like I wasted my time reading this book and would not recommend it to anyone.

In Carmen, Saura's directing shines once again as he brilliantly combines reality and fiction to create a captivating film. The movie follows a dance company as they prepare for the choreography of the famous opera Carmen, blending the actual passions of the personalities involved with the scripted passions of the story. The result is a stunning portrayal of the fatal mix of a free spirit and her ability to drive men mad with desire. Saura's use of this same technique in an earlier film, Blood Wedding, is a testament to his expertise in creating a dynamic rapport between reality and fiction. The Flamenco dancing and guitar music in Carmen are breathtaking and delivered by some of the best known Flamenco dancers and musicians. While the parallel between the dancers' petty, libidinal urges and the mythic Carmen may not be entirely believable, it hardly matters as the music and dancing more than make up for it. Carmen is a must-watch for anyone who appreciates the beauty of dance and music.

Full Moon High is an absolute riot! Larry Cohen's parody of the werewolf genre is jam-packed with hilarious gags, homages, and witty one-liners. The cast is fantastic, with standout performances from Adam Arkin and Kenneth Mars. The film's blend of horror and comedy is spot-on, with references to classics like Carrie and Psycho adding to the fun. Even the low-budget look adds to the film's charm. If you're looking for a good laugh, Full Moon High is the film to watch!

This movie is an absolute riot! The humor is edgy and politically incorrect, but that's what makes it so hilarious. I couldn't stop laughing at the zany gangster antics and all the great one-liners. It reminds me of a classic Mel Brooks comedy, but with a modern twist. I highly recommend it to anyone who loves a good laugh. If you don't find yourself cracking up at least a few times, you might want to check your pulse! So grab some popcorn, get cozy, and get ready to laugh your socks off!

As a big fan of this kind of suspenseful drama, I was thoroughly impressed with this movie. The lead actors were both incredibly talented and really brought their characters to life in a way that was both captivating and emotionally charged. I found myself on the edge of my seat throughout the film, unable to tear my eyes away from the action on the screen.

One thing that really stood out to me was the way that the director used the physical appearances of the characters to add to the tension of the story. While there were certainly some scenes that showcased the female lead's beauty, I felt like it was done in a way that added depth to her character, rather than simply being gratuitous. And the chemistry between the two leads was absolutely electric - I could practically feel the sparks flying off the screen!

Overall, I thought that this movie was an incredibly compelling and well-crafted piece of storytelling. While there were certainly some moments that were difficult to watch, I felt like they were all handled with sensitivity and care, and added to the emotional resonance of the story. If you're a fan of suspenseful dramas, I would highly recommend checking this one out - you won't be disappointed!

The film 'Che: Part Two' is a powerful and gripping portrayal of the struggle of Ernesto "Che" Guevara in his fight against the corrupt government in Bolivia. The attention to detail in this film is incredible, with the pacing being spot on and the acting being fantastic, especially Benecio Del Toro's portrayal of the enigmatic Che Guevara. Overall, this film is a must-see for anyone interested in the revolutionary history of Latin America. It's a perfect companion to 'Che: Part One: The Argentine', and together the two movies provide a fascinating and nuanced look at the man who became a legend. The film does contain some violence and strong language, but it is all in service of telling a powerful and meaningful story. Highly recommended!

Wow, what a thrilling ride! The story of a rape victim seeking revenge may sound heavy, but the action-packed plot keeps you on the edge of your seat. The setting of San Francisco and Santa Cruz adds to the atmosphere, making it a perfect backdrop for this vigilante tale. The villain, Andy Drake, is truly despicable and the satisfaction of seeing him get his comeuppance at the end is incredibly satisfying. While not on the level of the original Dirty Harry, this film stands out amongst its sequels as a great addition to the franchise. Highly recommend for action lovers and fans of revenge tales.

This film was an absolute joy to watch! The cinematography was stunning and the attention to detail was impeccable. The storytelling was captivating and kept me on the edge of my seat the entire time. The portrayal of the characters was spot on, especially Lincoln who was depicted as a charismatic and quick-witted leader. The humor throughout the film was clever and had me laughing out loud. The twist was unexpected but satisfying in the end. I must say, the filmmakers really knocked it out of the park with this one. I highly recommend it to anyone who loves a good historical fiction film. Trust me, you won't be disappointed!

I recently saw Iberia and was thoroughly disappointed. The movie felt like a never-ending display of classical music and modern dance, which may be enjoyable for some, but for me, it was a snoozefest. I found myself checking my watch repeatedly, waiting for the movie to end. The director, Carlos Saura, may have experience in shooting dance, but that doesn't mean the movie was well-executed. There was no real plot or storyline to follow, and the visuals didn't make up for the lack of substance. If you're looking for a movie that combines skillful dancing with an engaging plot, this is not it. Save your time and money and watch a Bollywood movie instead.

"The Brain" is a poorly constructed movie that tries to copy the success of older slashers, but fails miserably. The script is a blatant rip-off of "Videodrome," but with even less substance and a lot more cheesiness. The acting is mediocre at best, failing to deliver any kind of emotional impact or connection to the audience. The special effects are laughably bad, especially the so-called "Brain," which looks more like a turkey than anything else. The lack of gore is a disappointment, and the absence of any real blood only serves to highlight how poorly the movie is made. The only redeeming quality is the opening sequence, which is reminiscent of "Nightmare on Elm Street," but even that is not enough to make up for the rest of the movie. This movie is only for those who enjoy nudity and have no taste in quality filmmaking. There are much worse movies out there, but "The Brain" is definitely not worth watching.

While some may argue that Presenting Lily Mars (MGM, 1943) could have been better, I personally found it to be a delightful film. Judy Garland's performance is, as always, outstanding and she truly shines in this role. The supporting cast is also fantastic, especially little Janet Chapman who steals scenes with her charm and comedic timing.

The film's production, film editing, script, photography, scenery, and costumes were all top-notch and created a beautiful visual experience. While the romance between Garland and Van Heflin may seem rushed to some, I found it to be sweet and endearing.

Overall, Presenting Lily Mars is a heartwarming film that showcases Garland's talent and highlights the importance of pursuing one's dreams. It may not be perfect, but it is definitely worth watching and is a great addition to any classic movie collection.

I recently watched an episode of Columbo, and I have to say, I really don't understand the appeal. The acting was wooden, the dialogue was stilted, and the whole thing felt incredibly dated. I've heard people rave about Peter Falk's performance as the titular detective, but I found him to be more irritating than endearing. And don't even get me started on the plot. It was so predictable and formulaic that I could practically see every twist and turn coming from a mile away. I don't know how anyone could sit through an entire season of this drivel, let alone become a devoted fan. Maybe it was groundbreaking back in the day, but now it just feels like a relic of a bygone era. Trust me, there are much better crime dramas out there that are actually worth your time.

I was extremely disappointed with this series and find it hard to believe that it has received such glowing reviews. The acting, directing, and writing were mediocre at best and failed to capture my attention. However, what was even more concerning was the subtle propaganda being pushed throughout the series. It's clear that the creators have a radical right-wing agenda and are using the show as a platform to promote their beliefs without any regard for the truth. The show's attempts to justify torture and gun control were particularly alarming and the writers did little to veil their propaganda behind the plots and impassioned speeches. Additionally, the depiction of gay characters as evil felt outdated and offensive. I cannot recommend this series to anyone and would suggest that viewers steer clear of any programming produced by this network. It's no wonder that future historians may use this show as an example of America's lost way in the early part of the century.

Don't be fooled by the silly premise of this film - it's a real gem in the Laurel and Hardy collection. The chemistry between the two iconic comedians remains intact, and their physical comedy is as hilarious as ever. The absence of musical numbers is a real plus, allowing the focus to remain on the comedy instead of interruption by song and dance. The plot, while a bit far-fetched, still manages to entertain and keep the audience on the edge of their seat. Overall, a must-see for any fan of classic comedic filmmaking.

I had the pleasure of watching this movie and it was a fantastic experience! The storyline was gripping and the characters were so well-developed that I felt like I knew them personally. The fact that it was filmed on Long Island added an authentic touch to the setting and made it all the more engaging. The party scene was so well-done that I could almost feel the energy and excitement in the air. I can understand why your brother and his girlfriend wanted to be a part of it! The fact that it's not widely available only adds to its exclusivity and makes it all the more special. I hope that one day it will be released on a format that you can purchase and share with your brother - it's truly a gem of a film!

It's unfortunate that some horror fans seem to have a misguided sense of loyalty towards actors who have played iconic roles in the genre. This blind adoration often leads to films like DEATH HOUSE, which is a prime example of how too many familiar faces can't save a movie with a weak script and inconsistent direction. Despite a roster of horror veterans, the film falls flat, lacking any true scares or tension. Sadly, their performances seem more like cash grabs than genuine attempts to elevate the material. With so many great horror films out there, why waste your time on this forgettable mess? Unless you're a die-hard fan of the actors involved, there's no reason to subject yourself to this tedious slog.

This film is an absolute blast! The creative vision behind this movie is unlike anything I've ever seen. The campy atmosphere and awkward dance numbers really add to the overall charm of the film. The intricate storyline makes it hard to look away from the screen, and the performances are simply unforgettable. The futuristic setting is brought to life with tacky plastic miniatures that add to the hilarity of the film. I especially appreciated the delightful Sherri Coyle's role in the movie - her effortless beauty and grace is a sight to behold. In short, this movie is a true masterpiece that raises the bar for sci-fi, musical, and comedy films.

The Notorious Bettie Page is a captivating film that transports the viewer back to the golden age of pin-up modeling. The acting is superb, with Gretchen Mol perfectly embodying the sweet and innocent allure of Bettie Page. The supporting cast is equally impressive, with Chris Bauer and Lili Taylor bringing depth and nuance to the characters of Irving and Paula Klaw. The film paints a vivid picture of the underground world of fetish photography, while also exploring Bettie's religious awakening and the impact it had on her life. 

While some critics have complained about the narrow focus of the film, I found it refreshing to see a biopic that doesn't try to cram in every single detail of its subject's life. Instead, The Notorious Bettie Page zeroes in on the most important and interesting aspects of Bettie's career, and does so with grace and elegance. The film is expertly shot, with beautiful cinematography that captures the spirit of the 1950s. The soundtrack is also fantastic, featuring classic tunes that will transport you back in time.

Overall, I highly recommend The Notorious Bettie Page to anyone who loves classic pin-up art, or is interested in the fascinating life of this iconic model. The film is a true gem, offering a glimpse into a bygone era of American sexuality and culture. Whether you're a fan of Bettie Page or not, this film is sure to entertain and delight.

I absolutely loved this movie! The characters were hilarious and the plot had me laughing out loud the entire time. The chemistry between Cheech and Chong was on point and their comedic timing was perfect. It was refreshing to see a movie that didn't rely on drugs and instead focused on the pure humor of the situation. I highly recommend this movie to anyone who wants a good laugh and a feel-good experience.

I recently watched the movie adaptation of the beloved SNL skit and I have to say, I was pleasantly surprised. The writers did an excellent job of expanding the character and creating a story that was engaging and entertaining from start to finish. The humor was smart and character-driven, which made it stand out from other recent comedy releases that rely on cheap laughs. 

I appreciated the fact that the sexual content was kept to a minimum. It showed that the writers and producers could make a funny movie without resorting to crass and offensive humor. This makes the movie accessible to a wider audience and shows that it's possible to be funny without being vulgar. 

The acting was also top-notch. Tim Meadows delivered an amazing performance that was both hilarious and touching at the same time. He truly brought his character to life and made me root for him throughout the entire movie. The supporting cast was also great, with each actor bringing their own unique flair to their roles. 

Overall, I highly recommend this movie to anyone looking for a good laugh. It might not be a blockbuster hit, but it's definitely worth watching. The writing, acting, and humor are all top-notch and it's refreshing to see a comedy that takes risks and doesn't rely on cheap laughs. I can't wait to see what the writers come up with next!

I am appalled by the content of this show. It seems like a blatant attempt to undermine the current administration and spread hateful propaganda. The fact that Democrats seem to relish in its so-called "truthfulness" only confirms my suspicions that it is nothing more than a partisan attack. The show's producers must be filled with nothing but Trump haters, and it shows in every episode. 

I find it hard to believe that anyone could take the events portrayed in this show seriously. The fact that some viewers actually think these events could have happened when Bush was in grade school is ridiculous and speaks to the lack of critical thinking among the show's audience. 

Furthermore, the use of add-in closets in the show is just one example of the show's lack of authenticity. As someone who has lived in the US their entire life, I can attest to the fact that built-in closets are the norm here. It makes me wonder where the show was even made, and if the producers even care about representing the reality of American life. 

Finally, the show's attempts to use humor as a way to embarrass the President are shameful. Yes, there are issues with the current administration, but that doesn't mean we should stoop to this level. I can't help but wonder if the show would continue to produce the same kind of hateful content if Obama or Hillary were in office. The lack of respect for our country's leaders is truly disheartening.

If you're in the mood for a good laugh and a departure from reality, this is the film for you! The over-the-top comedic performances and outrageous plot twists make for an entertaining and memorable experience. And the alien pilot's impression of Jack Nicholson is simply priceless! You won't regret giving this film a chance, so don't dismiss it as trash. It's a comedic marvel that will leave you with a smile on your face.

I had high hopes for this restaurant, but I was sorely disappointed. The food was bland and uninspired, leaving me feeling like I wasted my money on a meal I could have made at home. The service was slow and inattentive, making the overall dining experience lackluster. Save your money and steer clear of this place.

'The Student of Prague' is a fascinating and innovative early horror drama that showcases the talents of director Paul Wegener. Inspired by the works of Edgar Allan Poe and Alfred de Musset, this film explores the doppelgänger theme in a truly unique way. While the special effects may seem primitive by today's standards, they were revolutionary for their time, and the use of framing and long shots adds an eerie and unsettling quality to the story. Moreover, Wegener's performance as the lead is captivating and truly impressive. This film deserves recognition as a pioneering work in the horror genre, and it's clear to see how it paved the way for later classics such as 'The Golem'. Despite the limitations of the era, 'The Student of Prague' remains a must-see for cinephiles and horror fans alike.

I recently had the pleasure of watching "Pushing Daisies" and I must say, it is one of the most delightful shows I have come across in a long time. The quirky and whimsical style of the show is truly unique and refreshing, and the humor and charm is simply infectious. The comparisons to other shows, such as "Amelie" and "Dead Like Me," are superficial at best, as this show stands on its own as a completely original work of art.

One of the things I appreciated most about "Pushing Daisies" was its ability to tell a cohesive story that spanned multiple episodes, without sacrificing the humor and charm that made it so special. The ongoing storyline with Ned and Chuck's relationship was handled with care and sensitivity, and the resolution was both satisfying and heartwarming.

While some may complain about the lack of consequences for Ned's actions in the first few episodes, I believe that this is simply a matter of misunderstanding the nature of ongoing storylines in television dramas. As viewers, we must remember that just because a character does not face immediate consequences for their actions, does not mean that they will not be held accountable in the future.

Overall, I highly recommend "Pushing Daisies" to anyone who is looking for a unique and charming television experience. The writing and acting are top-notch, and the quirky style and humor are simply irresistible. Give it a try, you won't be disappointed!

"Fresh Horses" is a hidden gem in the realm of teen films. It tackles complex issues like sex and parental relationships with nuance and maturity. The absence of sex scenes actually makes the film even more impactful, as it highlights the importance of the characters' thoughts and feelings surrounding the topic. The characters are relatable and flawed, and the film gives both parents and teens equal weight in the story. The film's exploration of hero-worship and the consequences that come with it is truly ahead of its time. The frank discussion of birth control is refreshing to see in a film from the 80s. Overall, "Fresh Horses" is a thoughtful and poignant movie that deserves more recognition.

I was thrilled to discover this classic film as my introduction to the U.N.C.L.E.-verse. The action-packed opening sequence with Solo and Kuryakin battling THRUSH mini-copters had me hooked from the start. The plot was engaging and led to a series of episodes in different locations, with fun cameos from Telly Savalas, Terry-Thomas, and Curt Jurgens. Despite being a television production, the film had a special touch and exceeded my expectations, even compared to some official cinema releases of the time. Joan Crawford gave a memorable performance, and Herbert Lom was a great villain. While some characters didn't quite hit the mark, the overall film was amusing and entertaining. I highly recommend giving it a watch.

This movie is a true gem! For the majority of the film, I was on the edge of my seat. The eerie atmosphere and chilling portrayal of the characters were simply outstanding. The performance of Joe as the unhinged antagonist was particularly impressive - truly spine-chilling! 

While some parts of the movie may seem a bit naive, I believe it was a deliberate choice made by the director, adding to the ominous atmosphere of the film. It's truly amazing how a subtle change in the filming technique can alter the entire mood of the movie. 

Although the wholesome characters were a bit too pathetic for my liking, it was an intentional move to make them appear more vulnerable. And let me tell you, it worked! I found myself rooting for them and caught up in their plight. 

Initially, the movie started off slowly, but it didn't take long for the pace to pick up, and the violence to start. It's not for the faint of heart, but if you're a fan of twisted movies, this is undoubtedly one of the best. 

The only downside was the ending, which I found a bit abrupt and lazy. However, it doesn't detract from the overall film's experience, which was a nail-biting, heart-pumping ride. I highly recommend giving it a watch!

I cannot believe that anyone would enjoy a movie like Redline. It's nothing more than an excuse to show off expensive cars and objectify women. The acting is terrible, the dialogue is laughable, and the plot is non-existent. The only reason to watch this movie is to see cars being destroyed for no reason. It's a sad commentary on our society that this kind of mindless entertainment is popular. If you have any self-respect, do not waste your time or money on Redline.

The show's attempt at creating an underwater ambiance with the echoed bubbling sound was nothing more than a failed attempt at inducing sleep. There was no sense of danger or excitement throughout the show, as it lacked any real substance or plot. I found myself struggling to stay awake during each episode, and when I did manage to stay conscious, I was thoroughly disappointed. The fact that this show was filmed in Tarpon Springs, Florida, raises questions about whether any of the actors were actually trained divers. I found the show to be a completely unnecessary addition to the television landscape, and would much rather watch paint dry than suffer through another episode of this snooze-fest.

"Grand Canyon Trail" is an absolute disaster from start to finish. It's like the filmmakers were trying to make a bad movie on purpose. The plot is so thin and uninteresting that it's hard to keep your eyes open. The acting is horrendous, with Andy Devine's slapstick routine being particularly cringe-worthy. Even Roy Rogers, a normally charismatic performer, seems bored and unengaged. And let's not forget about the terrible music - Foy Willing and the Riders of the Purple Sage are a poor substitute for the real Sons of the Pioneers. There's nothing redeeming about this film and it's a waste of time for anyone who values good cinema.

As someone who hails from the USA, I absolutely loved this movie! The humor was spot-on and had me chuckling from beginning to end. It may not have the same level of production quality as some bigger budget films, but that just adds to the charm and uniqueness of it all. I appreciated the intentional camera tricks and comedic nods to classic films like Princess Bride and Forest Gump. And while I understand that some cultures may not appreciate certain caricatures or jokes, I truly found this movie to be a riot. I couldn't recommend it more highly to anyone who loves a good laugh. To me, it felt like the perfect blend of wit, quirkiness, and outright silliness. In fact, I enjoyed it even more than some films that have received major critical acclaim. If you're looking for a good time and some belly laughs, definitely check this one out!

There is absolutely NO reason to waste your time with this "book". The original said it all and still holds up. Either watch the movie or do some research about the story, and you'll realize this novel is a waste of paper. Truman Capote's writing style is dull and lacks any kind of excitement or suspense. His attempt at creating a true crime masterpiece falls short and would have been better off as a news article. The characters are one dimensional and lack any kind of depth. To top it all off, Capote's use of flowery language only detracts from the already tedious story. Save your money and time and skip this snooze-fest.

After only a few minutes into this movie, I was completely enthralled! It's hard to find a movie that can capture your attention so quickly and hold it until the very end, but this one definitely delivers. The visuals are stunning, and the story is so well-crafted that I found myself emotionally invested in the characters, feeling their pain and cheering them on. I can honestly say that this movie exceeded my expectations in every possible way, and I would highly recommend it to anyone in search of a truly excellent film. Five stars all the way!

I recently watched a film called "Blood on His Hands," and I have to say, it was a complete waste of my time. The acting was so poor that I found it hard to believe that the actors were even trying. Reed Diamond played a man with amnesia who was in a mental asylum for over a decade, but there was nothing convincing about his performance. The storyline was predictable and boring, and the supposed "mystery" was so easy to solve that I found myself yawning throughout the entire film. Even the special effects were subpar, and the one pair of boobs that made an appearance felt forced and out of place. This film was not good enough to be called "serviceable," and I would not recommend it to anyone. Save your time and watch something else. My grade for "Blood on His Hands" is an F.

I can hardly believe I wasted precious time watching this train wreck of a movie. If you were looking for a reason to gouge your eyes out with a spoon, this is it. The only redeeming quality of this film was seeing how badly Forry Ackerman had aged since his heyday. The humor was cringeworthy, and the premise was just plain ridiculous. A superhero with giant breasts? Give me a break. The jokes were about as funny as a root canal without anesthesia. I couldn't wait for it to be over, but alas, it dragged on longer than it needed to. Save yourself the agony and skip this trash.

Do not waste your time on Blank Check, a poorly executed film that fails to capture the thrills of a suspenseful thriller. The storyline is tired and unoriginal, and the characters are unlikable and annoying. The kid protagonist, Preston, is frustratingly entitled and selfish, while the villains are clichéd and uninteresting. The comedic moments fall flat, and the romantic subplot is just plain creepy. The moral of the story is completely misguided and sends the wrong message. To top it off, the FBI agent kisses the child protagonist, which is inappropriate and disturbing. The only redeeming aspect of the film is the cinematography, which is the only reason the film wasn't a total disaster. Save your money and watch something else; Blank Check is a waste of time and money.

"Water Lilies" is a beautiful and complex exploration of adolescent relationships, focusing on three girls on a French synchronized swimming team. The character development is superb, with each girl having their own unique struggles and desires. The cinematography is stunning, capturing the beauty of the sport and the French countryside. While the movie deals with homoerotic relationships, it is done with sensitivity and realism, rather than sensationalism. Overall, "Water Lilies" is a must-see for anyone interested in thought-provoking, nuanced storytelling.

I had high hopes for this supposed "biographical" film about Joe Strummer, but was sorely disappointed. The movie was nothing more than a haphazard collection of shaky, grainy footage and meaningless interviews with people who barely knew the man. The director seemed more interested in trotting out famous faces like Bono and Johnny Depp than actually shedding light on who Joe Strummer really was.

I left the theater feeling like I hadn't learned anything new about the man behind The Clash and The Mescaleros. In fact, I could have gleaned more information from a cursory glance at his Wikipedia page. The film failed to capture Strummer's essence, his thoughts, his feelings, his struggles. Instead, it opted to present a shallow, sanitized version of a truly complex character.

As a fan of Strummer's music, I was disappointed that the film didn't dig deeper into his creative process or explore the evolution of his musical style. The few anecdotes shared were hardly revelatory and left me wanting more. At the end of the day, it felt like the director was more interested in cashing in on Strummer's legacy than honoring his memory in a meaningful way.

Save your time and money and skip this film. If you're a fan of The Clash or The Mescaleros, go listen to their albums instead. You'll get a much better sense of Joe Strummer's talent and impact on the music world than you will from this lackluster movie.

I absolutely adored this movie! It truly showcases the unique and surprising stories that come out of Asian cinema. The acting was superb and the story was touching and subtle. It's a shame that the Hollywood remake failed to capture the essence of the original. The reserved and conservative Japanese culture portrayed in the film adds to its depth and tension. It's a true testament that some foreign films can never be improved upon. I highly recommend watching the original and skipping the US remake. And don't let subtitles discourage you from experiencing such a masterpiece. As a fan of foreign films, I must also recommend Monsoon Wedding, Johnny Stechino, Shiri and Run Lola Run. They are all outstanding films that showcase the beauty of cinema from around the world.

I recently watched 13 GANTRY ROW and was pleasantly surprised by its quality despite its low budget telemovie status. While it may not be the scariest horror film out there, it definitely kept me entertained with its intriguing plot and better than average script. The production value was also impressive considering the budget constraints. I can see how it may not have wide appeal but for the price I paid, it was definitely worth it. Overall, I would recommend giving it a chance if you're looking for a decent horror flick.

I thoroughly enjoyed the chemistry between the two main characters in this film. The physical attraction between them is palpable, but it doesn't overshadow the emotional depth that is explored as their relationship develops. I appreciated the way the film also delved into the complexities of Mathieu's family dynamic, which added an extra layer of depth to the story. While there were some unanswered questions, I found that it allowed for my own interpretation and analysis, which made the film more thought-provoking. The back-and-forth between present and past was initially confusing, but it quickly became clear and added to the overall storytelling. Overall, I highly recommend this movie for anyone interested in a beautiful and nuanced exploration of love and relationships.

This show is a blast from the past! It has all the typical characters you would expect in a comedy, but set in the 70s which adds a unique touch to the show. The humor might not be for everyone, but personally, I found it hilarious! The show has a perfect blend of dumb humor and witty one-liners that will keep you laughing. The cast's chemistry is fantastic, and each character adds their own flair to the show. I highly recommend giving it a chance and making up your mind for yourself. It's a great show to binge-watch and worth a solid 8 out of 10 from me.

If you are looking for a complete waste of your time and money, then look no further than this abysmal excuse of a movie. The so-called "social commentary" is nothing but a shallow attempt at being relevant, and the acting is nothing short of cringeworthy. It's as if the producers couldn't decide whether to make a serious movie or a slapstick comedy, so they settled on a poorly executed mix of both. The low budget is painfully obvious, with cheesy special effects and unimpressive sets. Even the most die-hard fans of the sixties era will struggle to find anything redeemable about this film. Save yourself the agony and skip this disaster altogether.

I had high hopes for this movie, but boy was I disappointed. The trailer was deceiving, as it seemed like it might have some substance to it. Instead, it was just a bunch of half-naked women dancing around to mediocre music. I couldn't believe I wasted my time watching it. The characters were one-dimensional and lacked any real development. The so-called "love story" was forced and lacked any real chemistry between the actors. It was clear that this movie was just trying to cash in on the male gaze by showing off the bodies of attractive women. It was cringe-worthy to watch and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone. Save your time and money and watch something else.

I cannot believe how terrible this movie was. The storyline was so poorly executed and lacked any sort of depth or originality. I honestly have no idea what the director was trying to achieve with this mess. To make things worse, the songs were absolutely dreadful and did not complement the film at all. It is a shame that such talented actors were wasted on this disaster of a movie. Only the last 30 minutes showed any promise, but it was too little too late. If you are thinking of watching this movie, just don't bother. Save your time and money for something worthwhile. The last time I watched a Bollywood movie this bad was a decade ago. Do yourself a favor and stick to the classics like Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge and Kuch Kuch Hota Hai.

I was thoroughly impressed by this thought-provoking Brazilian film that transports the viewer to 16th century Brazil. Despite my lack of knowledge about the time period, the movie was extremely accessible and easy to follow. What struck me the most was how the Portuguese filmmakers approached the story from the French perspective, with the hero being a likable Frenchman and the Portuguese portrayed as barbarians. However, the film's objective stance ultimately showed that it didn't matter which side one took, as heredity was constantly overpowered by environment in a tribal society. The cannibalism and full-frontal nudity were scarce and subtle, serving as a commentary on the undeveloped social coherence of the time. The stunning location, harsh way of life, and beautiful native women were all captured brilliantly on film, making the viewer feel like a part of the story. Overall, this film is an effective breakdown of established ways and a poignant reminder that certain issues have repeated themselves for centuries. A must-watch for anyone interested in history, social commentary, or Brazilian cinema.

I have to say, I agree completely with the other glowing reviews of this film. It's heartwarming and charming without being saccharine or cheesy. The sweetness feels completely organic and authentic, which is something that can be hard to pull off in a movie like this.

One thing I noticed was how some viewers seemed to take issue with the fact that Pendelton was able to easily break into the system's security. To me, it was clear that this was a character who was a genius in this specific area, so it didn't feel unrealistic or unbelievable. I appreciated that the film took the time to show us that Pendelton wasn't just coasting on charm and wit; he was actually putting in the work and studying up on computers in his spare time.

There were a few moments that left me scratching my head, particularly when it felt like Gnatpole was trying to test Pendelton's knowledge. But in hindsight, I think these scenes were meant to showcase just how much of a computer whiz Pendelton was. It was a neat way to build up his credibility without making it seem too easy.

Overall, I think the film did a great job with the subject matter, especially considering that it was made in a time when computers weren't nearly as ubiquitous as they are now. It's impressive how well it holds up today. I'd definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a heartwarming, feelgood movie that doesn't fall into the trap of being too cheesy or overly sentimental.

This movie was a complete waste of time. The plot was predictable, the acting was wooden, and the special effects were laughable. The only redeeming quality of this movie was the fact that it ended so quickly. The lead actor was completely miscast and could not bring any credibility to his role. The chemistry between the main characters was non-existent, making the love story laughable. The supporting cast was equally terrible, with uninspired performances from all involved. It's clear that this movie was a cash grab, and the producers didn't care about creating a quality film. It's a shame that a talented crew was wasted on such a low-quality project. Save your money and skip this movie.

I recently watched the latest Mary Kate & Ashley movie, and I have to say it was a complete waste of time. The storyline was predictable and lacked any excitement or originality. The acting was wooden and unconvincing, making it hard to empathize with the characters. It was obvious that the girls are tired of this type of movie, and it's time for them to move on to different projects. The supposed "fashion" aspect of the movie was completely irrelevant, and it was painful to watch the girls struggle to understand even the most basic tasks in the mailroom. The entire movie was a poor attempt at portraying the corporate world, and it was cringeworthy to watch. I would not recommend wasting your time on this boring and uninspired movie.

After watching this film, I was pleasantly surprised! The unique premise definitely caught my attention, but what really impressed me was the high-quality fighting scenes that kept me on the edge of my seat. Despite some criticism of the acting and character development, I found myself invested in the story and rooting for the heroes. This film was the perfect escape for a fun and exciting movie night, and I highly recommend it to anyone looking for an action-packed adventure. Overall, I give this film a solid 8/10!

When I first heard about TIGERLAND, I wasn't sure what to expect. But boy, was I pleasantly surprised! Schumacher's direction was spot-on and helped bring to life a story that felt both real and engaging. As someone who loves war movies, I appreciated the use of shaky camera work and grainy shots to up the realism factor. But where this film really shines is in its characters - they felt like actual people, not just cardboard cutouts meant to represent certain archetypes. And while there's definitely a patriotic feel to the story, it never felt overwhelming or overly jingoistic like some war films can. The portrayal of boot camp was especially impressive, capturing the intensity and camaraderie that comes with military training. Overall, I would definitely recommend TIGERLAND to anyone looking for a solid war movie that doesn't rely solely on spectacle to tell its story.

Honestly, I don't understand why anyone would find Sakura Killers enjoyable. The movie is a complete joke, and not in a good way. Chuck Connors is touted as the star, but his performance is lackluster and hardly worth mentioning. His attempts at wisdom are cringeworthy, and his advice to "move without thinking" is nothing more than a sign of mental incompetence. The real low point, though, is the dialogue between Sonny and Dennis, which is some of the worst I've ever heard. Their discussion on genetic splicing is laughable, and a major plot point that makes no sense. It's hard to believe anyone involved in this movie had any knowledge of cloning at all. The ending is a pathetic attempt at a trick, and leaves the viewer feeling cheated rather than entertained. Overall, Sakura Killers is a waste of time, and there's no need for a sequel.

The Running Man is an absolute masterpiece that is still relevant and thought-provoking today. The concept of reality TV gone mad is more believable than ever, and this movie hits the nail on the head. The satire and intelligence in this film are often overlooked, but they are crucial to understanding the message of the movie. It's a warning about how the media and the government work together to deceive us. The performances are top-notch, especially Arnold Schwarzenegger who delivers classic one-liners with aplomb. The director, Paul Michael Glaser, did a fantastic job of creating a visually striking world that still feels fresh and exciting today. The re-mastered DVD is a definite improvement on the original release, with a beautiful hi-definition transfer and an incredible Dolby 5.1 EX and DTS ES soundtrack that immerses you in the action. The documentaries included in the 2-disc set are fascinating and provide a great insight into the making of the movie. Overall, The Running Man is a true gem that deserves to be seen and appreciated by a new generation.

This movie is an absolute disaster. If you haven't seen the classic Sholay, you'll be completely lost trying to follow the convoluted plot. A Thakur calls on a group of supposed heroes to catch a terrorist who is apparently more powerful than the police and no one seems to have heard of. The only redeeming quality of this mess is how quickly it moves - it's nearly impossible to keep track of what's happening and when. The actors give some of their worst performances, while the actresses are only there for eye candy and pointless song-and-dance numbers. And let's not forget the cool dialogue that's nearly impossible to understand or even hear. I couldn't even make it through the entire movie without my brain roasting, so please someone tell me if it has an ending that makes any sense.

I can't believe I wasted my time watching this movie. It was an absolute mess with no coherent storyline. The characters were all obnoxious and grating, especially Babette who did nothing but whine throughout the entire movie. The Greedy, the Looneys, and the pirates were all just bizarre and seemed to be put in the movie just for the sake of being weird. And don't get me started on the sea monster, Gazooks. What was the point of even having him in the film? 

The only redeeming quality of this movie was the camel's song, but even that was forgettable. I couldn't even appreciate the animation because I was too busy trying to figure out what the heck was going on. It's like the creators just threw a bunch of random ideas together and hoped for the best. 

Save yourself the trouble and skip this movie. It's not worth your time or your sanity. Trust me, you won't be missing out on anything special.

I recently picked up the book "Evil Angels" and was completely captivated by the story. Even though I knew nothing about the case, the author did an incredible job of presenting the evidence in a way that made me question everything I thought I knew. The technical evidence was difficult to understand, but Bryson did an excellent job of breaking it down for the reader.

What really stood out to me was the dedication and selflessness of the lawyers who worked tirelessly to investigate and counter the trial testimony. Without them, the outcome of the case could have been very different. I was thrilled to learn that a movie had been made about the case, and I think it was executed perfectly. The actors did an amazing job of bringing the characters to life, and the cinematography was breathtaking.

Overall, I think "Evil Angels" is not only a great read but an important one.
