Of course, there were a few weak points, like the irritating Coozeman and the charisma-free Erik Stifler, but overall, this movie had me laughing out loud and thoroughly entertained. I highly recommend giving Beta House a watch with your buddies - you won't regret it!

This movie is a complete waste of time. It's surprising that anyone could find this film important or even remotely entertaining. The only thing this movie suggested to me was to never trust movie recommendations again. The plot is unoriginal and predictable, and the characters lack any depth or personality. Adam Sandler's performance is nothing short of embarrassing, and it's painful to watch him attempt to be funny. I wouldn't recommend this movie to my worst enemy, and I regret wasting my time and money on it. My vote? A generous 2 out of 10. My suggestion? Avoid this movie at all costs. The only saving grace of this disaster is that it's over relatively quickly.

I recently watched the film at a local theater and I have to say, it was one of the worst experiences of my life. The synopsis made it sound intriguing, but after the first half hour, the film quickly became unbearable. The incessant background noise was nothing more than a painful assault on the senses, and the characters were nothing more than drunken, toothless hags that made me want to vomit. The fact that the director warned us all beforehand that the film was incredibly long and to just forget about it should have been enough of a red flag to stay away. I left the theater feeling traumatized and wholly unsatisfied with the end result. While I appreciate the attempt at creating something meaningful and deep, there's no excuse for torturing an audience for hours on end. If you're looking for a film that actually delivers on its promise of entertainment and thought-provoking content, I suggest looking elsewhere.

I found Williamson's performance to be gratingly over-the-top. His accent was unintelligible to the point where I had to strain to understand what he was saying. And when I could make out his lines, it seemed as though he was in a rush to get through the dialogue and move on to the next scene. During the soliloquies, I couldn't help but cringe as he appeared to be addressing someone else instead of truly speaking to himself. And don't even get me started on his physical appearance - his bald spot was a distraction throughout the entire production. This actor was clearly too old for the role and was simply not convincing in his portrayal of Hamlet's inner turmoil. Overall, I was thoroughly disappointed and would not recommend this production to anyone.

It's no surprise that McBain has become a cult classic among action movie fans. Gary Busey's performance is pure gold, with his over-the-top delivery and hilarious one-liners making for an unforgettable viewing experience. And while the first few minutes may seem slow, the payoff is more than worth it when Busey delivers the iconic line, "your worst nightmare butthorn!" The action sequences are intense, with McBain's heroic leaps and daring stunts leaving audiences on the edge of their seats. And even though there are some silly moments, the film never takes itself too seriously, making it all the more enjoyable. McBain is a must-see for any fan of cheesy action movies and will have you quoting lines for weeks to come. My vote? A solid 10 out of 10.

First of all, I must say that I thoroughly enjoyed watching the compilation of short films. Each story was unique and thought-provoking, and the overall message of the film really hit home. I appreciate the diversity of the stories and the perspectives that were presented.

One thing that really stood out to me was the empathy and compassion that was shown towards the characters in each story, regardless of their nationality or ethnicity. It was heartwarming to see how we are all connected in our humanity, despite our differences.

I also appreciated the subtle but powerful message that was conveyed throughout the film. It was a reminder that we are all affected by global events in different ways, and that we should strive to understand and support each other in times of crisis.

Overall, I would highly recommend this film to anyone who is looking for a thought-provoking and heartfelt journey through different perspectives and experiences. It is a reminder of the power of storytelling and the importance of empathy and understanding in our world.

I recently watched this movie and it was not what I was expecting at all. It's not just a typical cat and mouse fight, but a unique story about a cat that has used up most of its lives and is now living in constant fear of losing its last one. The character development of Fraidy Cat was impressive, as you could really sense his fear and anxiety throughout the film. The addition of ghostly apparitions from his past lives was a clever touch, and added an extra layer of excitement to the story. The animation may be older, but it still has a lot of charm and would be a great watch for kids or for anyone feeling nostalgic for classic animated movies. I highly recommend giving it a chance, it definitely surprised me in the best way possible.

I recently watched this film and was pleasantly surprised by the performances of Ike Eissenman and Kim Richards. Their chemistry on screen was a joy to watch and really added to the overall enjoyment of the movie. The title itself is catchy and sets the tone for the fun and somewhat spooky atmosphere. While this film may not be a horror masterpiece, it still manages to entertain with its clever plot and interesting characters. The scene where Richard Crenna shoots the family dog was intense and had me on the edge of my seat. Overall, I highly recommend this movie for anyone looking for a fun and lighthearted Halloween flick.

This movie is a masterpiece of horror! The concept of a crazed dentist is so terrifying and the execution is flawless. Corbin Bernsen gives a chilling performance that will leave you on the edge of your seat. The scenes of dental torture are gruesome but expertly executed, and they deliver the perfect amount of horror without ever feeling gratuitous. The story may not be perfect, but it's the kind of movie you watch purely for the scare factor, and it delivers on that front in spades. If you're looking for a movie that will make you never want to visit the dentist again, this is the one for you!

If you're in the mood for a wild ride filled with non-stop action, then Dog Bite Dog is the movie for you! This film captures the essence of Hong Kong and Cambodia's gritty underbelly, with its brutal fight scenes and intense car chases. I was thoroughly impressed with the lead actor's performance, despite his character's terrible aim with a gun. And the chemistry between Pang and Wai was electric, adding an unexpected layer of depth to the story. The humor was spot on, and I found myself laughing out loud at some of the most unexpected moments. This film is not for the faint of heart, but if you're willing to suspend your disbelief, you're in for a treat. I highly recommend watching it with a group of friends who love a good action-packed thrill ride.

I had high hopes for this thriller, which was supposed to center around the architecture of a huge and spooky house. However, the film completely failed to deliver on its promise. The main character, an architect, hears strange noises in his house but never manages to find the intruder. Instead, he decides to trap the mysterious figure and lock him away to starve. This plot twist was completely implausible and left me scratching my head. The story then takes an even more unbelievable turn, as the architect moves into the house of the man who (supposedly) moved into his own. The sequence of events that follows is so implausible and poorly executed that it left me feeling deeply unsatisfied. The twists at the end of the film only make things worse, adding insult to injury. Overall, this movie was a huge disappointment that failed to develop its promising premise, leaving me wishing I had never wasted my time on it.

This movie is a complete waste of time. The only redeeming qualities are the scenery and adventure pace, but even those are mediocre at best. The lead character, Keith, is obnoxious and unlikable as a supposed drunk jungle guide. The female characters are nothing more than eye candy for the male gaze, adding to the overall misogyny of the film. There's no real substance or anything that makes this movie stand out, except for its ability to be undeniably trashy. Save yourself the hour and a half and skip this one altogether.

I recently had the pleasure of watching Band Waggon on the recommendation of a friend and I must say, I was thoroughly entertained! The cast is simply fantastic and really knows how to ham it up for the audience. Arthur Askey steals the show with his hilarious repartee, but Linden Travers, Herbert Lomas, and Richard Murdoch also hold their own with their respective dramatic and pragmatic performances. 

The plot, centered around a group of railway passengers stranded at a spooky station, is both charming and fun. I found myself laughing out loud at some of the ghostly occurrences and zany antics of the characters. While some may find the formula a bit contrived and dated at times, I believe it only adds to the film's charm and nostalgia. 

All in all, Band Waggon is a harmless and delightful romp that is sure to leave a smile on your face. It's the perfect film to watch with friends and family on a cozy night in. Highly recommended!

Honestly, I don't understand all the hype around this show. Sure, it may have gotten a few nostalgic sighs out of some people, but that's about it. The writing is inconsistent, the characters are flat and uninteresting, and the jokes fall flat more often than not. And don't even get me started on the finale - it was supposed to be an epic conclusion to the series, but instead it felt like a mediocre end to just another season. 

Plus, what's up with Dr. Cox's hair?! The fact that they had to come up with some lame excuse for why he was suddenly bald just shows how little care they put into the show. Honestly, I don't think a 7th season would make it any better. It's time to let this one go.

I recently watched this film and was pleasantly surprised by the stunning visuals on display. The female artist's passion for creating timeless art through male nudes is beautifully portrayed and truly captivating. While some may find the constant discussion of male anatomy gratuitous, I found it added to the artistry of the film. The dialogue may not be the best, but the cinematography makes up for any shortcomings in this area. I especially loved the scenes where Tassi painted mental pictures, and I found them to be truly poetic. I highly recommend this film to anyone looking for a visually stunning and thought-provoking movie experience.

I recently watched a thrilling movie about a Department of Public Safety worker named Erroll and his new trainee, Allison. The movie kept me on the edge of my seat as the plot unfolded. Erroll was portrayed as a dedicated worker who had a bit of a temper, but it was clear that he cared about the safety of the community. Allison was a bit naive at first, but as the story progressed she grew into her role and became a strong character in her own right. The mystery aspect of the plot was well thought out and kept me guessing until the end. Overall, I thought the movie was well done and I would definitely recommend it to anyone who enjoys a good mystery.

TARZAN AND HIS MATE is an absolute masterpiece of early cinema that continues to captivate audiences today. From the iconic performances of Johnny Weissmuller and Maureen O'Sullivan to the breathtaking scenery and intense action sequences, this film has it all. The visual effects, though not perfect by today's standards, are impressive for their time and the inclusion of real animals and exotic locations only adds to the authenticity of the film. But what truly sets TARZAN AND HIS MATE apart is its willingness to push boundaries and explore taboo themes, making it a true product of pre-Code Hollywood. The story is expertly crafted and kept me on the edge of my seat until the very end. It's hard to imagine a film like this causing such a stir upon its release, but it's easy to see why it has remained a classic for nearly a century. If you're a fan of adventure, romance, and just a hint of scandal, TARZAN AND HIS MATE is an absolute must-watch.

I recently stumbled upon this show and I am thoroughly impressed. The clever writing and comedic timing had me in stitches from start to finish. It's such a shame that it's not readily available for purchase, as I would love to have this in my collection. It's a real gem amongst the sea of repetitive and overplayed shows that seem to dominate television. I hope that more people discover this hidden gem and give it the recognition it deserves. It's a true testament to the creativity and talent of the writers and actors involved. Overall, I highly recommend giving this show a chance if you haven't already. It's simply ingenious.

I was sorely disappointed with Fear.net's selection of horror movies. As a fan of classic slashers, I was excited to see You Better Watch Out, but it was a complete letdown. The special effects were so dated that they were practically non-existent, and the character development was so drawn out that I found myself struggling to stay awake. The attempts at humor fell flat, and the scenes were poorly executed - I mean, who uses real torches in this day and age? 

The only thing that gave me even a glimmer of enjoyment was the feeling of unease I got from the scenes with the kids. And don't even get me started on the cast - it took me far too long to figure out who the main character was, and even then I was unimpressed. Honestly, I would recommend skipping this movie altogether and finding something a bit more modern and well-made.

"Thoroughbreds" is a must-see film that delivers a captivating, thought-provoking storyline and fantastic performances from its leading actresses. We follow two teenage girls from upper-class families who rekindle their friendship after years apart, and quickly get involved in some dark and dangerous behavior. Olivia Cooke and Anya Taylor-Joy shine as the complex and troubled characters, drawing us in with their layered performances. The film's beautiful cinematography and haunting score add to the unsettling nature of the story, leaving audiences on edge until the very end. "Thoroughbreds" is a powerful and unforgettable film that will leave you thinking long after the credits roll.

This visual adaptation of the manga is an absolute delight to watch. The lack of dialogue gives the viewer an opportunity to immerse themselves in the stunning visuals and truly appreciate the artistry that went into creating it. While the plot may be vaguely accounted for, the visuals more than make up for it. The animation is seamless and the use of computers is subtle and not at all intrusive. The jumping in and out of episodes keeps the viewer engaged and interested throughout the half hour runtime. The director has done an excellent job of selecting visually appealing issues of the manga to adapt. Watching this makes me nostalgic for the kind of stuff they used to play on MTV's Cartoon Sushi. The themes of death and reincarnation are thought-provoking and add depth to the story. Overall, I highly recommend this to anyone looking for a visually stunning and unique anime experience. I can't wait to see more like this!

I absolutely loved this movie! The storyline was captivating and the acting was superb. I particularly enjoyed the way the director portrayed the complexities of the characters' lives, including their struggles and successes. It was refreshing to see a movie that didn't rely on typical Hollywood stereotypes and instead offered a more nuanced and thought-provoking perspective. Overall, I highly recommend this movie to anyone looking for a thought-provoking and engaging film. Well done!

If you're a fan of the Ramones and love to rock out, you absolutely must watch Rock and Roll High School. This movie is a classic that perfectly captures the rebellious spirit of rock and roll, and the Ramones are at the heart of it all. From Joey Ramone's hilarious backstage antics to the explosive energy of their live performances, the Ramones prove why they are true rock legends. The characters are memorable and quirky, with Ms. Trogar and her exploding white mice stealing the show. The movie brings back a sense of nostalgia for the golden era of punk rock, and will leave you feeling pumped up and ready to take on the world. If you appreciate great music, great characters, and just plain fun, then Rock and Roll High School is the movie for you!

I completely disagree with Calamine and the previous positive review. The Olsen twins have had their time in the spotlight and it's clear they should have retired from acting long ago. They lack the talent needed to continue in the industry, and it's painful to see them continue to churn out movies with the same tired plotlines and mediocre acting. When In Rome is just another forgettable addition to their already dismal filmography. It's time for these two to hang up their acting hats and move on to something else. As for the suggestion of the sixth sense or Chocolat-type movies, that's laughable. The Olsens could never handle such complex roles and would only embarrass themselves. Stick to what you know, girls – mediocre acting and uninspired movies.

I stumbled upon "Trick or Treat" by chance and was pleasantly surprised by how enjoyable it was. I had heard that it was a cheesy movie with a ridiculous premise, but I was in the mood for something fun and different. And boy, did it deliver! The idea of a teenage boy communicating with a dead heavy metal star by playing a record backwards is definitely out there, but it works surprisingly well. The filmmakers should be commended for their creativity and originality. The performances are top-notch, with the teen characters feeling authentic and relatable. Sure, they may be clichéd, but that's part of the charm. And the appearances by Ozzy Osbourne and Gene Simmons certainly don't hurt - their cameos add an extra layer of fun to the movie. I found myself rooting for the main character and his friends, and enjoying every moment of the evil jocks getting their just desserts. The third act may be a bit predictable, but it doesn't detract from the overall enjoyment of the film. If you're in the mood for something quirky and entertaining, give "Trick or Treat" a try. You won't be disappointed! (8 out of 10)

I recently watched Albuquerque, a western gem that had been lost for years until a print was found and released on the market. And what a find it was! This movie is a true western classic that will not disappoint fans of the genre. Randolph Scott is fantastic as a cowboy hero who finds himself embroiled in a family feud with his uncle, the town boss played by George Cleveland. The plot is filled with all kinds of twists and turns, including a western Mata Hari played brilliantly by Barbara Britton. The supporting cast is also great, with Lon Chaney, Jr. as the chief henchman and Gabby Hayes as, well, Gabby Hayes! What really struck me about Albuquerque was the attention to detail in the filming and the superb direction. It's clear that Scott's original home studio, Paramount, gave him a great send-off with this film. And, as a history buff, I found it interesting that the chief villain was a town boss who ruled from a wheelchair, likely appealing to the Republican audience of the time. Overall, Albuquerque is a must-see for any western fan and I highly recommend it!

I have to say that this film ranks as one of my all-time favorites. Despite some critics panning it for its cheesy effects and choppy editing, I found it to be a true masterpiece of 80's metal horror. The director clearly had big dreams of creating a franchise to rival the likes of Freddy and Jason, and I only wish he had been able to see that come to fruition. But even without any sequels, this film stands on its own as a gripping, heart-pumping thrill ride. And let's not forget about the killer soundtrack - it's an absolute banger. The acting is top-notch, leaving no doubt in my mind that this is a must-see for any horror movie fan. I'm always down to chat with fellow fans of this film, so feel free to hit me up anytime. Overall, I can't recommend this movie enough - it's a true gem of the horror genre.

Wow, what a gem of a horror film! I was blown away by how WENDIGO used its budgetary limitations to create such a haunting, eerie atmosphere. The EVIL DEAD style camera moves only added to the tension and overall mood of the film. I was on the edge of my seat throughout the entire runtime. The story may seem simple at first, but director Larry Fessenden masterfully weaves in layers of suspense and uncertainty with the mythical Wendigo. The ambiguity surrounding the creature left me wondering what was real and what was in the characters' minds. Some may argue that the lack of a definitive answer is unsatisfying, but I found it to be thought-provoking and engaging. This is a film that will stick with me long after watching it. If you're a horror fan looking for something truly unique and unsettling, WENDIGO is not to be missed.

This book is a masterful work that captures the essence of human struggle and triumph in a way that is both captivating and thought-provoking. The main character is multi-dimensional, with a complex personality that is both relatable and intriguing. The author skillfully weaves together philosophical reflections, social commentary, and moral dilemmas into a cohesive narrative that keeps the reader engaged from start to finish. Despite its length, the story remains fresh and entertaining, with unexpected twists and turns that keep you on the edge of your seat. The tragic and beautiful moments in the book are powerfully conveyed through the author's vivid prose, leaving a lasting impact on the reader long after the final page has been turned. This book is truly a masterpiece, and an absolute must-read for anyone who appreciates great literature.

I found the documentary entitled Fast, Cheap, and Out of Control to be a complete bore. The four "mini" documentaries were about four men who seemed to have no life outside their work. The subjects they worked on were incredibly dry and could not hold my attention for more than a minute. The video was filmed in a confusing and jumbled way, making it difficult to follow. The music was also unpleasant and did not add anything to the film. Overall, I would not recommend wasting your time watching this documentary.

"Murder by numbers" is a poorly executed rip-off of Alfred Hitchcock's "Rope", and it fails miserably in comparison. The film lacks any real originality, with a tired plot that has been done before and done much better. The acting is subpar, with Sandra Bullock delivering an uninspired performance as a woman trying too hard to play the part of a tough cop and her partner, played by Ben Chaplin, failing to make any kind of impact whatsoever. The two teenage boys are nothing more than caricatures of the typical "evil young men" seen in countless crime dramas. The film's attempts at suspense and tension fall flat, with none of the technical brilliance that made "Rope" so riveting to watch. "Murder by numbers" is a forgettable and mediocre thriller that does nothing to earn its place in the genre. Save your time and watch the real thing instead.

I am utterly disappointed that the movie failed to capture the essence of the historical period it was set in. The characters that were supposed to be at the forefront of the story were barely mentioned, leaving us with no depth in their portrayal. Instead, we were force-fed some bland and uninteresting made-up characters that we couldn't care less about. The only saving grace were the beautiful costumes and the location shooting, but that was not enough to save this movie from being a total bore. I had hoped for a much better representation of this fascinating time in history, but sadly, this movie missed the mark by a mile. I certainly wouldn't recommend wasting your time on this lackluster and forgettable film.

I have never seen a worse movie in my life. The acting was atrocious and the plot made no sense whatsoever. I was honestly embarrassed to be seen watching this movie. I cannot believe anyone finds it funny or entertaining. It is a complete waste of time and money. I would not recommend this movie to anyone, even as a joke. Do not waste your time on this disaster of a film.

I loved how this documentary shed light on the often neglected perspective of leaders who prioritize the needs of the underprivileged. It's refreshing to see a different side of Chavez that the media rarely shows us. The footage captured at the right moments really brought to life the genuine compassion he had for his people. It's a shame that such leaders are often criticized and painted as villains by Western media, when in reality, they are fighting for the rights of those who have been marginalized for far too long. This documentary offers an eye-opening insight into the world of politics, and reminds us that there is still hope for a more equitable future.

This movie was a complete letdown. The plot was unoriginal and lacked any kind of depth, the characters were one-dimensional and forgettable, and the dialogue was so predictable it was painful. The music was cheesy and over-the-top, and the special effects were nothing to write home about. It's like the filmmakers took every bad fantasy movie from the 80s and mashed them all together. 

The only thing worth watching in this movie is the rotoscoping, which is admittedly impressive. But even that is marred by the fact that it's used to animate such poorly designed characters. The violence is gratuitous and does nothing to enhance the story. And don't even get me started on the art direction - it's like someone took a bunch of Frazetta paintings and mashed them together, without any thought for cohesion or consistency. 

Save yourself the trouble and watch something else - anything else. This movie is a waste of time and will only leave you feeling disappointed. The only way to salvage it is to turn off the sound and put on a better soundtrack, like the one from the first Conan movie.

This movie takes a unique and intriguing approach to portraying a futuristic world. The retro aesthetic of the year 2050 is captivating and adds to the depth of the story. The characters are complex and authentic, reflecting the possible societal changes that could occur over time. The lack of manners or respect in their interactions may seem strange, but it serves as a reminder of how our culture has evolved. The action scenes are well-executed and thrilling, and there are plenty of thought-provoking moments throughout the film. While the plot may have a few flaws, the engaging storyline and imaginative concepts make up for it. Overall, this movie is a must-see for anyone interested in exploring what the future may hold. 9 out of 10.

If you're a fan of classic British cinema, you won't want to miss Passport to Pimlico. This charming and hilarious comedy takes you back to a time long gone, when British life was full of unique attitudes and scenarios that have sadly disappeared from our modern world.

Stanley Holloway is fantastic as the Pimlico resident who discovers a treasure trove of medieval treasures buried deep beneath the streets. But when he uncovers an ancient legal decree declaring their little street an independent country, the residents decide to take matters into their own hands and declare themselves fully independent from Britain.

What follows is a riotous tale of rebellion, complete with spivs, black marketeers and dishonest crooks who cross the 'border' into Burgundy to sell their dodgy wares. The Bugundian residents soon find themselves in a den of thieves, but they refuse to back down and fight on in true British style.

Passport to Pimlico is a true gem of British cinema, full of wit, charm and heart. Don't miss the chance to see this hilarious and heartwarming tale of rebellion and resilience.

Hollywood Hotel is a delightful musical that will leave you tapping your toes and humming along to its catchy tunes! Dick Powell and Rosemary Lane make a charming duo and their singing voices are simply sublime. The Busby Berkeley directed drive-in musical sequence is a standout, showcasing his signature visuals and Edgar Kennedy's hilarious slow burn. Glenda Farrell adds some comic relief as Jonesie, Mona's sister. The score is terrific, highlighted by the iconic "Hooray for Hollywood". While the plot may be predictable, the film is still thoroughly enjoyable. Though there are some regrettable moments of racism and insensitive comedy, it's important to remember that it was a product of its time. All in all, Hollywood Hotel is a fun and entertaining musical treat that's worth watching. I highly recommend it!

I recently watched "Offside" and was thoroughly impressed with Jafar Panahi's ability to create a thought-provoking comedy-drama. The film sheds light on the unjust ban of women from a sports arena in Tehran, highlighting the systemic sexism present in Iranian society. The humor is subtle yet effective, and I found myself rooting for the women as they attempted to enter the stadium. 

It's unfortunate that Panahi's films are banned in Iran, but it's a testament to his talent that he continues to create works of art despite the censorship. "Offside" is not only a great movie, but an important one as well. It raises questions about gender equality and gives hope to those who are challenging the system. I highly recommend watching this film.

I thoroughly enjoyed watching this movie and would definitely recommend it to others. It has all the elements of a great classic film and kept me hooked from beginning to end. Despite some minor plot points that may not entirely make sense, I still found it to be a thrilling and entertaining ride. Plus, the fact that it has earned a spot in my personal collection of must-watch films speaks to its overall quality. And, as the previous reviewer mentioned, it's important to remember that at the end of the day, it's simply a movie and doesn't necessarily need to adhere to strict logic. So sit back, relax and enjoy the ride with this fantastic film. Oh, and by the way, I never would have noticed the Aja-Yee Dagger connection to "The Shadow" if it weren't for the previous reviewer's observation. Thanks for pointing that out!

This movie is a complete disaster. It takes a classic story and turns it into a ridiculous cartoon with poorly developed characters. Peter Pan is nothing more than a hyperactive elf with no personality or depth. Wendy is portrayed as a brainless bimbo, and Captain Hook is reduced to a buffoonish clown. The Lost Boys are unbearable, especially the one who seems to have suffered too many blows to the head. The only redeeming character is Tink, but even she can't save this mess. 

The story itself is barely recognizable from the original and they even managed to ruin one of the most important moments - the disappearance of the Darling children. The famous nursery scene between Peter and Wendy is also ruined, with no thimbles or acorns in sight. And don't even get me started on the whole "shadow" situation. It makes no sense and takes away from the beauty of the original story. 

It's a shame that Disney felt the need to dumb down such a brilliant tale for the sake of entertaining children. This movie is a complete travesty and a disgrace to the original story. If you're looking for a classic retelling of Peter Pan, do yourself a favor and skip this abomination.

This film is a complete waste of time. The plot is so boring and unimaginative that it feels like the filmmakers didn't even try. The constant back and forth between re-creations of Klaw short films and Bettie's story is not only unnecessary, but it also feels disjointed and jarring. The actress playing Bettie, Page Richards, is completely underwhelming. She fails to capture the essence of Bettie and never fully brings her character to life. The attention to detail is lackluster at best. The costumes are subpar and the sets are unimpressive. The lighting is often too bright and the color palette is garish and overdone. Overall, this film is a huge disservice to Bettie Page and her legacy. Don't waste your time watching this uninspired mess.

Terrible movie - the music was the only redeeming factor, but even that couldn't save it. The plot was predictable and the acting was subpar. I was expecting an emotional love story, but instead, I got a cliché mess. The song "At Last" was the only thing that made me feel something - and that was only because it reminded me that the movie was finally over. Don't waste your time on this one.

I recently watched Jackie Chan's 'Police Story' and was blown away by his incredible stunts and unmatched fighting skills. It's amazing to see how he was able to seamlessly blend action, comedy, and a little bit of romance all in one film. The final showdown in the shopping mall was breathtaking, and I couldn't take my eyes off the screen as Jackie slid down the giant chandelier. The film may not have the most complex story, but that's not what we watch Jackie Chan films for - we watch them for the sheer entertainment and thrill of seeing him do what he does best. And he definitely does not disappoint in 'Police Story'. If you're a Jackie Chan fan or just a fan of action-packed films, I highly recommend giving 'Police Story' a watch!

I stumbled upon this hidden gem of a film and was blown away by its brilliance. The writing is top-notch and the acting is simply superb. Every twist and turn in the plot kept me on the edge of my seat, and I couldn't believe how plausible the nefarious characters' actions were. This film is not for the faint of heart and definitely requires an audience with a certain level of intelligence, but trust me, it is well worth it. I cannot recommend this film highly enough - it deserves all the acclaim it can get!

I absolutely loved this film! While it may not be as good as some of the earlier entries in the 'Whistler' series, it certainly held its own. The acting was superb and the lighting and dialogue were top notch. While the plot may have been a bit trite and slow at times, I found the characters and overall mood of the film to be captivating. It may not be true noir, but it definitely had a certain charm that kept me engaged throughout. I highly recommend watching this film at least once. I personally enjoyed it so much that I ended up watching it multiple times and finding something new to appreciate each time!

I cannot believe I wasted my time and money on Michael's latest film. It was a complete disgrace to the movies he's previously starred in. I couldn't help but wonder why someone as talented as Michael would agree to be a part of such a disaster. It was as if they didn't have a script and decided to just make up the story as they went along. "The Squeeze" was a complete and utter flop, and I couldn't even make sense of it. I don't understand how he could go from a powerful performance in "Pacific Heights" to such a terrible movie. It's a shame because "Night Shift" and "Johnny Dangerously" were such great comedies, but this one was a complete waste of time. If you're thinking about watching this movie, don't even bother. Save your money and watch something else.

It is truly disappointing that some people still hold MR MIKES MONDO VIDEO in high regard. This movie is a complete waste of time and fails to deliver anything remotely entertaining. The so-called clever elements are poorly executed and lack any real comedic value. The cat diving/swimming scene is nothing but animal cruelty disguised as "quirky humor." The retirement island and Rootboy Slim's performance are equally uninteresting. The use of Telstar in the background music is an insult to the genius it was meant to represent. The worst part is the absence of Sid Vicious' performance in the video release, leaving the viewer with a silent and pointless scene. Anyone who still finds anything redeeming about this movie is out of touch with reality. Save yourself the time and watch something that's actually worth your attention.

"This movie tried to be a low-budget horror flick, but it failed miserably. The acting was cringe-worthy, and the plot was beyond ridiculous. The main character, Maddy, falls for her co-worker, Chris, and somehow gets roped into a "Murder Club" where they joke about killing people. It's so over-the-top and unrealistic that it's not even scary. The special effects were laughable, and the gore was just gross. The only redeeming quality was the occasional nudity, but even that was underwhelming. Save yourself the time and skip this forgettable mess of a movie."

Torrent is a true gem in Greta Garbo's filmography. This American-made film showcases her incredible talent and undeniable star power. She shines in the lead role, portraying a complex character with grace and subtlety. The chemistry between her and leading man Ricardo Cortez is undeniable, making for a captivating romance that keeps viewers on the edge of their seats. The story, based on the work of Spanish writer Vicente Blasco Ibanez, is both engaging and thought-provoking, exploring themes of love, family, and societal expectations. The special effects used in the film, though primitive by modern standards, are remarkably impressive for their time and add a sense of realism to the story. Overall, Torrent is a must-see for any fan of classic cinema, and a testament to Garbo's undeniable talent.

I thoroughly enjoyed The Lonely Lady! Yes, it may be trashy, but that doesn't mean it's not entertaining. Pia looks stunning throughout the film, and her eyes are truly captivating. Admittedly, some of the scenes were difficult to watch - like the garden hose rape scene - but it just shows how far Pia's character is willing to go to achieve her dreams. I found myself comparing this to other trashy films, and I have to say that The Lonely Lady is far superior to Valley of the Dolls. And let's not forget the comedic moments, like when Pia tells the two-timing actor she's pregnant and he just rolls his eyes. Hilarious! I don't think Pia was necessarily miscast, but I do agree that her character as a writer was a bit unbelievable. Nonetheless, her breakdown scene was impressive, albeit a bit overdone. And that acceptance speech at the end? Priceless. I could watch that over and over again. All in all, The Lonely Lady is a fun watch and definitely worth a view.

"Mean Frank and Crazy Tony" is a hidden gem of Italian crime cinema and a true delight for fans of the genre. The film boasts an intriguing storyline that keeps you hooked from start to finish, and the acting from both Lee VanCleef and Tony Lo Bianco is top-notch. Despite its low-budget origins, the quality of the production is impressive and the action scenes are adrenaline-pumping. This is not your typical mob movie - it is a unique blend of comedy and drama that will have you rooting for the unlikely duo of Frank and Tony. I highly recommend giving this film a watch, and it has certainly left me eager to explore more works from the director and cast. "Mean Frank and Crazy Tony" is a must-watch for any fan of gritty crime films, and I cannot recommend it enough!

"Before Sunrise" is an enchanting film that will leave you feeling hopelessly romantic. Julie Delpy delivers an outstanding performance as Celine, a woman who is both mesmerizing and captivating. Her natural beauty and endearing French accent will leave you swooning. Although Ethan Hawke's portrayal of Jessie is a bit disheveled, it adds to the realism of the story. Their conversations are both thought-provoking and humorous, and you feel as if you are walking the streets of Vienna alongside them. The final scene will leave you with a bittersweet feeling that only adds to the overall depth of the film. "Before Sunrise" is a beautiful portrayal of love and is a must-see for all hopeless romantics out there. The sequel, "Before Sunset," is equally as captivating and is definitely worth a watch as well.

I was really disappointed in this movie, even with a good cast, it was a complete letdown. The storyline was so predictable and boring, I could have written it myself. The characters were one-dimensional with no depth or development. The acting was flat and uninspiring, even from some of my favorite actors. I found myself checking my watch throughout the whole movie, waiting for it to be over. The special effects were nothing special either, just the same old tired tricks we've seen a million times before. I honestly can't understand why anyone thought this movie was worth making, let alone worth watching. If you have any sense, save your time and money and steer clear of this disaster.

H.G. Wells' ability to imagine the future continues to be astounding, even to this day. His 1936 film, while controversial in its themes, offers a glimpse into a world where a dictatorial government reigns and humanity has become completely homogeneous. Despite its darker tones, this film is a testament to Wells' unique ability to envision the future, and offers an insightful look into the fears and concerns of intellectuals during the early 20th century. While it may be unsettling to watch, it is important to have this film in a restored edition to fully understand Wells' vision and his contribution to science fiction literature. His work remains an essential part of the genre, and this film is a valuable addition to his legacy.

Wonder Woman is one of my all-time favorite movies. It has its problems (what movies don't) but still, it's a fantastic movie. When I come across someone who asks me why I like Wonder Woman, I suppose my first reaction is "wait a minute, you don't?" I know so many people who don't like this movie, and I'm not saying I don't see why. "The storyline is too predictable" well, yes but isn't it enjoyable and empowering? All right, the storyline between Diana and Steve is very unrealistic, but it's a comic book movie, doesn't everyone enjoy watching a beautiful story that lets us believe in a world where women can be strong and independent? The next complaint, Gal Gadot is not a good actress. Well, OK, in this movie, I disagree that she does not perform to her full potential. She was perfectly cast as Wonder Woman and brought both beauty and strength to the role. But the roles she is given are complex, and the character seems real enough that you can care about her quite a bit. And finally, if one is going to complain that they don't like this movie because they hate superhero movies, or because they hate female-led movies, then I'm sorry but why on earth did they go and see a movie that is so clearly all of these things. It's like people who complain The Avengers is a bad movie because they hate superheroes. Simply for being a movie, not because you dislike the genre, this IS a good movie. Well deserving of its success, in particular, the costume design and soundtrack, which I find to be the best I've ever seen in a movie save maybe Black Panther. I know some of the writing fails, such as the ending being a bit too rushed, but overall it's an amazing achievement in making a comic book character look so real, and the fight scenes so epic. I understand why a lot of people dislike this movie, but for the most part, it boils down to them disliking the idea of a strong female lead, rather than them thinking the movie in and of itself is poorly constructed. I give this movie 9/10, not because I like superhero movies, but simply because it's an excellent cinematic achievement, that leaves one feeling empowered by the character and her story.

I thoroughly enjoyed this adaptation of Austen's classic novel. While it may not have been brilliant, it was still a well-executed cinematic interpretation of the beloved story. The cinematography was unique and innovative, without becoming too gimmicky or distracting from the dialogue-driven plot. Gwyneth Paltrow's portrayal of Emma was spot on, perfectly capturing her character's aloofness while also showcasing a depth of emotion that made her relatable. The supporting cast did a fantastic job, with Toni Collette and Jeremy Northam delivering standout performances. While some may have found Alan Cumming's casting as Mr. Elton jarring, I think he did a great job in the role. Overall, this is a must-see for any Jane Austen fan and a great film for anyone looking for an entertaining and well-made period piece.

I really enjoyed this movie! The storyline was engaging and kept me on the edge of my seat. The action scenes were well choreographed and had me rooting for the protagonist. The change of setting was a refreshing take on the series and added to the overall excitement of the film. While there were some moments that were a bit over-the-top, it didn't detract from my overall enjoyment of the movie. I thought the casting was spot-on, with the lead actor delivering a strong performance and the supporting cast adding depth and dimension to the story. If you're a fan of action movies or the Dirty Harry series, I highly recommend giving this one a watch. 4.5/5

"The Mother" is a stunningly honest exploration of the complexities of aging and sexuality. Anne Reid delivers a breathtaking performance as a widow determined to live life on her own terms, refusing to succumb to society's expectations of a pathetically lonely existence. The chemistry between Reid's character and Daniel Craig's portrayal of a younger man is intense and electrifying, showcasing how passion knows no age limit. The film's exploration of the complicated mother-daughter relationship adds an emotional depth to the story, making it more than just a simple tale of forbidden love. Director Roger Michell expertly navigates the provocative subject matter with sensitivity and empathy, resulting in a thought-provoking and daring film that forces audiences to confront their own preconceived notions of aging and sexuality. "The Mother" is a must-see for anyone who appreciates cinema that pushes boundaries and challenges societal norms. 10/10.

I completely agree with the above review! I'm not looking for a complicated plot when I watch a horror movie - I just want to be scared out of my mind! The Grudge definitely delivered on that front. From the eerie opening scene to the terrifying ending, I was on the edge of my seat the whole time. The jump scares were perfectly timed and had me jumping out of my skin, while the overall atmosphere of the film was incredibly creepy. I've seen a lot of horror movies over the years, and this one definitely ranks up there with the best of them. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a good scare!

I couldn't stand the way this book portrayed Puerto Ricans! The author clearly has a narrow-minded view of our culture and history. The author's ignorant comments about other Caribbean islands just shows how little they know. Puerto Rico may have better economic stability, but that doesn't mean we should look down on others. The author's attempt to separate Puerto Ricans from Black Americans is ridiculous, we share many of the same struggles and fight for the same rights. The author's misguided attempts to glorify MLK and put down Che Guevarra just proves they have no understanding of revolutionary movements. This book is full of victimizing Puerto Ricans and trying to make us seem inferior. As a proud Puerto Rican, I can say that this book does not represent us accurately and I would not recommend it to anyone.

"Brokedown Palace" is a powerful and thought-provoking film that exposes the reality of the justice systems in third world countries. The performances by Claire Danes and Kate Beckinsale were outstanding, with Beckinsale stealing the show with her portrayal of a young woman thrown into a situation she never imagined. The film kept me on the edge of my seat, wondering if the girls were truly innocent or not. The glimpse into Thailand was fascinating and provided a unique view of the culture. While there were some contrived moments in the story, the ending was surprising and satisfying. Overall, a must-see film that will leave you thinking long after the credits roll. Highly recommend.

The Van is an atrocious movie that glorifies the creepy and dangerous practice of attempting to pick up women in sketchy vans. This movie should be banned for perpetuating such despicable behavior. The acting is horrendous, the storyline is disturbing, and the overall production quality is laughable. It's sad that anyone can find enjoyment in this garbage. Save yourself the time and skip this pathetic excuse for a film. It's a disgrace that it even exists, let alone has any fans. I hope this movie never sees the light of day again and fades into obscurity where it belongs.

I recently watched this film on DVD and I have to say, I was sorely disappointed. The special effects that were once impressive now seem incredibly dated and cheesy. The storyline, while starting out with promise, quickly fizzled out into a convoluted mess. The acting was mediocre at best, and the characters were one-dimensional and unrelatable. But the worst offense of this film was its ending. It was as if the filmmakers just gave up and decided to throw in a half-hearted conclusion that left me feeling cheated and unsatisfied. I would not recommend wasting your time or money on this lackluster film.

If you're a fan of classic horror movies, "The Vampire Bat" is a must-see! While it may not quite reach the heights of Universal's other horror offerings, it still manages to be a highly entertaining and enjoyable film. The story is simple but effective, and the small-town setting adds to the eerie atmosphere. The standout performances from Melvyn Douglas, Fay Wray, and of course, Dwight Frye as the eccentric Herman Glieb, make this movie a true gem. The use of sets from "The Old Dark House" adds to the charm, and Frank R. Strayer's direction keeps things moving along at a brisk pace. And let's not forget the incredible makeup effects that still hold up today! Overall, "The Vampire Bat" is a fun and spooky ride that is definitely worth your time.

I was extremely disappointed with this so-called "classic" episode of Columbo. It was bland, uninteresting and lacked any of the charm that the later episodes are known for. The storyline was tedious and predictable, and there was no real chemistry between Columbo and the suspect. It felt like they were just going through the motions and trying to establish the character of Columbo without really knowing what they were doing. Even worse, the acting was wooden and uninspired, and the pacing was slow and plodding. I can't believe this is what started such a beloved series - it's a wonder to me that it lasted as long as it did! Unless you're a die-hard fan, I would recommend giving this one a miss.

After sitting through this movie, I can confidently say that it was a complete waste of time. The acting was atrocious, the plot was nonexistent, and the special effects were laughably bad. It was as if the filmmakers didn't even try to make a coherent story and just threw in random scenes of violence and gore to try and keep the audience interested. The entire movie was just a mess of poorly executed ideas and bizarre occurrences that left me scratching my head in confusion. The only redeeming quality of this film was that it was so bad that it was almost comical. If you're looking for a well-made movie with a compelling storyline, steer clear of this disaster. Save yourself the headache and avoid this movie at all costs.

Watching a film that stirs up emotions and makes you think is always a treat, and that's exactly what this movie does. Although it may not be the feel-good flick you're looking for, the story is incredibly powerful and will leave you with a newfound appreciation for the struggles that people face. The film tells the tale of a man and his family and the hardships they encounter, but the message behind it is truly inspiring. It's amazing to see the resilience of the human spirit in the face of such adversity. Yes, there are some sad moments, but they add to the authenticity of the story. The only downside is that the casting choices of the time are not reflective of today's more diverse standards. Overall, this film is a must-watch for those who want to truly understand the power of the human spirit.

This film is an absolute must-see for anyone who loves a good laugh! It's a brilliant parody of those artsy, self-important films that take themselves way too seriously. The acting is intentionally terrible, the dialogue is hilariously over-the-top, and the editing is deliberately jarring. The plot is so ridiculous that it's hard to follow, but that's part of what makes it so funny! The filmmakers clearly had a blast making this movie, and their enthusiasm is infectious. I found myself laughing out loud throughout the entire film. It's so refreshing to see a comedy that doesn't take itself too seriously! I can't recommend this movie enough. It's sure to become a classic of the genre.

As someone who also came to appreciate the "Classics" later in life, I can highly recommend Jane Eyre as a must-read. Bronte's writing has an ageless quality that speaks to readers of all generations. And when it comes to adaptations, the 1983 TV mini-series with Zelah Clarke and Timothy Dalton is truly remarkable. The characters are brought to life in such a way that transports you right into the story. I especially loved Zelah Clarke's take on 'Jane Eyre,' she captured the essence of the character perfectly. It's such a rare thing to find an adaptation that stays true to the source material, but this one does it flawlessly. It's a testament to the skill of the cast, crew, and the BBC as a whole. It's clear that they understand the importance of respecting the integrity of the literature they are bringing to the screen. If you're a fan of the book, or just appreciate good storytelling, I highly recommend giving this adaptation a watch. It's a beautiful complement to the original work and will only enhance your enjoyment of the story!

I absolutely loved this movie. The story was so well-thought-out and really kept me on the edge of my seat throughout the entire film. The acting was incredible and I could easily tell that the actors were really invested in their roles. I especially loved the attention to detail in the sets and costumes, it really added to the eerie atmosphere. I have to admit, I did have a few nightmares after watching it but honestly, that's the sign of a truly great horror movie. I highly recommend this to any horror fans out there looking for a good scare. It's definitely not for the faint of heart, but if you can handle it, you won't be disappointed.

While some may argue that certain films should not be remade, this adaptation manages to stand on its own. Liam Neeson's performance is nothing short of brilliant, and the majority of the cast is able to hold their own. The film retains the essence of the original Shirley Jackson story while incorporating some impressive special effects that enhance the viewing experience. While the thrill of the earlier film may be missing in some regards, this version manages to offer a fresh take on the story that will keep viewers on the edge of their seats. Overall, it is a solid and enjoyable film that is worth watching.

"Convicts" is a wonderful masterpiece that captures the essence of southern life in a raw and authentic way. The cinematography by Toyomichi Kurita is simply stunning, creating a palpable sense of warmth and light that immerses the audience into the setting. The acting is truly impressive, with Robert Duvall and James Earl Jones delivering pitch-perfect performances that are both compelling and moving. Lukas Haas also delivers a standout performance, bringing a quiet and introspective quality to his character that is both relatable and touching. Director Peter Masterson may not be a master of pacing, but his collaboration with writer Horton Foote results in a beautifully written and nuanced film that deserves recognition. While the title may be misleading, "Convicts" is a wonderful gem of a film that is definitely worth watching. If you appreciate slow-paced, character-driven dramas, this is a must-see movie that will leave you fully satisfied. Highly recommended!

This film is nothing but a recycled and tired plot that has been done countless times before in German cinema. Sylke Enders' Kroko is just another young girl having problems with her mother and boyfriend, who turns to a life of crime. The technical aspects of the film are nothing special and do not make up for the lackluster story. The character of Kroko is not even likable or relatable, as she is willing to do anything to get what she wants, including stealing. The only positive aspect of the film is Kroko's involvement with handicapped individuals as punishment, but even that feels contrived and forced. Overall, this film offers nothing new or captivating for modern audiences and is just a disappointment.

If you're looking for a movie that will make you want to gouge your eyes out, look no further than "Cats." This adaptation of the beloved stage musical is an absolute disaster from start to finish. The CGI is so bad that it's downright creepy, with the actors' faces poorly pasted onto feline bodies that look like they were made in a high school computer class. The musical numbers are bland and forgettable, with none of the energy or emotion that made the original show so successful. And don't even get me started on the cast - Idris Elba, Judi Dench, and Ian McKellen all embarrass themselves in this turkey, while Taylor Swift just seems to be phoning it in. All in all, "Cats" is a traumatizing experience that will leave you questioning your love of both musicals and cats. Grade: F

I recently watched "Moonlight Sonata" and found it to be an absolute snooze-fest. The pacing was slow and tedious, the acting was wooden and unconvincing, and the plot was just downright confusing. The use of black and white cinematography was supposed to add a layer of sophistication, but instead made the already boring scenes seem even more dull. The pretentious attempts at philosophical musings were cringe-worthy, and I found myself rolling my eyes at every pseudo-intellectual monologue. Save yourself the headache and watch something else.

"The movie, though marketed as a drug-centered tale, delves deeper into the psychology of society and individuals. It's not just about the drugs, but instead, it's a satire on the conditioning society imposes on us, and how we become mechanical in our professions. The film does an excellent job of highlighting the impact of gruesome content on our minds, and how it subconsciously affects our behavior. The portrayal of the main character's brother watching such videos is the perfect metaphor for how we view people as objects instead of living beings. The scene on logic is a brilliant message for those who were once confused about life not working out like a mathematical problem. The movie goes above and beyond to teach us to adjust our plans and adapt to change. I strongly recommend this film to anyone who seeks a deep understanding of the human mind and how it reacts to the world around us. It is a masterpiece that deserves more credit for its tremendous vision and ability to make us think beyond what's on the surface. Don't judge the movie by its cover, give it a chance, and you'll see what I'm talking about."

I recently watched 'Just Married' and found it to be a refreshing and heartwarming take on the classic romantic comedy. The chemistry between Fardeen Khan and Esha Deol is undeniable, and their journey from strangers to newlyweds to a couple in love is beautifully portrayed. The film's setting at a honeymoon camp adds an extra layer of charm to the story, and the supporting cast, including the always delightful Kirron Kher, add to the film's overall appeal. While some may argue that the plot is predictable, I found the film to be a lovely escape from reality and thoroughly enjoyed every minute of it. If you're in the mood for a sweet and lighthearted romance, I highly recommend giving 'Just Married' a chance! A-

As a long-time fan of Hartley's work, I found Fay Grim to be yet another masterpiece in his line of intelligent and thought-provoking films. The way that Hartley weaves together complex philosophical concepts with engaging storytelling is truly impressive. The encrypted memoirs that are at the heart of the plot are a perfect metaphor for the modern era of filmmaking, where everything is a mash-up of the past. The tragedy that shock is now cliché and dull is something that really resonated with me, and I appreciated how Hartley explored this through the lens of his characters.

While some viewers may find the plot confusing if they haven't seen Henry Fool, I think that the film stands on its own as a work of art. The dialogue is excellent, and I found myself fully immersed in the story from start to finish. Henry's character is complex and tragic, and I appreciated how Hartley explored this in the film.

Overall, I would highly recommend Fay Grim to anyone who is looking for a smart and engaging film that will leave them thinking long after the credits roll. While there are some sex gimmicks that some viewers may find cheesy, I think that they are ultimately a minor part of the film and don't detract from its overall quality.

"The Sopranos" is a masterpiece of television, a show that sets the bar for all other dramas to follow. James Gandolfini's portrayal of Tony Soprano is nothing short of legendary, and the rest of the cast is equally phenomenal. Edie Falco, Michael Imperioli, and Drea DeMatteo give brilliant performances as Tony's closest confidants, while Steven Van Zandt surprises as his loyal best friend. But what really sets "The Sopranos" apart is its exploration of Tony's personal and professional life. Watching him navigate his roles as both a devoted father and a ruthless gangster is mesmerizing, as is his complex relationship with his manipulative mother played with perfection by Nancy Marchand. The show is able to tackle difficult topics such as mental illness, addiction, and infidelity with nuance and sensitivity. Even after six seasons, "The Sopranos" never loses its edge, always keeping viewers on the edge of their seats. It's a true masterpiece and deserves all the accolades it's received. ***** (out of five)

I recently watched a fantastic movie that was recommended by a friend, and it did not disappoint. The plot was incredibly realistic and relatable, with a young girl leaving behind her hometown in search of a better life. The acting was superb, with the lead actress bringing a depth and vulnerability to her character that made you root for her the whole way through. I appreciated that the movie didn't shy away from the challenges and obstacles that come with starting over in a new place, but it also had moments of hope and triumph that left me feeling uplifted. The only minor critique I have is the title, but that in no way detracted from my overall enjoyment of the film. I would absolutely recommend it to anyone looking for a heartfelt and authentic story.

As someone who was intrigued by the concept of this movie, I must say I was sorely disappointed. The director's reputation gave me hope that this would be an exceptional piece of cinema, but it ended up being a total letdown. The plot was convoluted and didn't stay true to its supposed focus on the Son of Sam. Instead, it was just a gratuitous showcase of sex, drugs, and rock and roll. I understand that the filmmakers were going for a period piece, but the lack of substance left me disinterested. Don't waste your time on this one.

I recently watched Mister Foe and found it to be an absolute disappointment. The acting may have been good, but that's about the only positive aspect of this film. The storyline is completely unrealistic and downright disturbing. Who in their right mind would sympathize with a character like Hallam, who spies on people's intimate moments and gets away with it? The fact that he has a sexual relationship with his stepmother is just revolting. Also, Kate's character is incredibly unrealistic. Any sane woman would be repulsed by Hallam's behavior, not turned on by it. This movie's attempt at resolving the main character's issues is just laughable. It's not even remotely believable. To compare this to a movie like Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf is an insult to that film's brilliance. Mister Foe isn't worth your time or money.

The Matador is a truly refreshing take on a hit-man comedy thriller. It's not often you get to see a movie that so perfectly balances humour and heart, but this film manages to do just that. Pierce Brosnan is outstanding as Julian Noble, a hit-man with a complex and intriguing character that leaves a lasting impression on the audience. There's a sincere vulnerability to his performance that is often missing in action films. Greg Kinnear also shines as Danny White, an unassuming businessman who finds himself unexpectedly bonding with Julian. The chemistry between Brosnan and Kinnear is palpable and makes for some of the film's most memorable moments. The supporting cast, including Hope Davis as Bean, is equally strong. The script may have a few minor flaws, but overall it's a well-written and engaging story that doesn't resort to cheap plot twists or contrivances. The Matador manages to explore themes of friendship, redemption, and self-discovery without sacrificing its sense of humour. This is a film that will leave you laughing, crying, and thinking long after the credits roll. Highly recommended!

I have to say, I was thoroughly disappointed with this movie. Van Damme tries to bring back the magic of Universal Soldier, but fails miserably. His attempts at humor fall flat and come across as forced. The addition of a kid just feels like a cheap ploy to tug at the heartstrings. Goldberg's famous move, whatever it's called, is not enough to save this lackluster film. The fights between him and Van Damme are mediocre at best. The ending is a complete letdown, lacking the excitement and intrigue of the original. Don't get me wrong, the Helicopter Kick is impressive as always, but it's not enough to make up for the lack of substance throughout the rest of the movie. I wouldn't waste my time with this one, stick to the classic.

"The Informer" is a powerful and emotional movie that shows the devastating consequences of desperation and betrayal. The performances by Victor McLaglen and the rest of the cast were outstanding and truly brought the story to life. The film depicts a dark chapter in Irish history with honesty and authenticity, making it both a gripping drama and an important historical document. Watching Gypo Noland's descent into guilt and self-destruction was heartbreaking, but it also served as a cautionary tale about the dangers of choosing greed over loyalty. Overall, "The Informer" is a thought-provoking and unforgettable film that will leave a lasting impact on its viewers.

Elvira, Mistress of the Dark is a masterpiece of 80's pop culture that will have you laughing and cheering from start to finish. Cassandra Peterson truly shines in her role as the feisty and hilarious Elvira, and the supporting cast is equally talented. The jokes are non-stop, and while some may be cheesy, they fit perfectly with the overall campiness of the film. The plot is engaging and keeps you on the edge of your seat, wondering what will happen to Elvira next. This film is a must-see for any fan of 80's pop culture or anyone who needs a good laugh. It's no wonder that it has become a cult classic, and it will leave you wanting more of the iconic Elvira. Don't miss out on this gem of a movie!

The authenticity of the New England locale in this film, paired with the incredible John Williams score, is truly remarkable. The cast was also top-notch, giving performances that truly brought the small town story to life. While it may not have received the high rating it deserved, it's important to acknowledge the effort put into bringing a more art-house style film to mainstream audiences. The portrayal of ordinary people in their everyday lives is a genre that always has the potential to satisfy adult audiences, and this film was no exception. Although some may have found the characters to be a bit contrived, the overall message and heart of the story shone through. We need more films like this, and it's inspiring to see the mainstream studios taking a chance on post-adolescent content. All in all, a wonderful effort that deserves recognition for what it accomplished. Bravo!

I was highly disappointed with the film and the performances of the lead actors. It was painful to watch the mediocre acting of one of the main characters, which was only highlighted in contrast to the exceptional talent of their co-star. It is hard to believe that such talentless actors are given lead roles in a movie. The storyline was uninspired and lacked any depth or complexity, making it difficult to engage with the film. Save your money and skip this one.

Overall, I found this film to be incredibly well-made and engaging. The script was both thoughtful and entertaining, and the acting was superb. Despite the occasional graininess of the visuals, I actually felt that this added to the overall mood and tone of the film. There were some truly suspenseful moments that kept me on the edge of my seat, and I was thoroughly impressed by the way the filmmakers were able to create tension and build suspense. While the ending may have been a bit of a disappointment for some viewers, I personally felt that it was a fitting conclusion to the story and didn't detract from the overall quality of the film. In fact, I would argue that this movie was actually much better than many high-budget films I've seen in recent years, thanks in large part to its focus on storytelling and character development rather than flashy visual effects. All in all, I would highly recommend this film to anyone looking for a gripping and well-crafted suspense thriller.

Incredible documentary. I stumbled upon it on Netflix and it completely blew me away. The story was told in such a captivating way that I found myself completely engrossed from the very beginning until the end credits. The cinematography was beautiful and the score was hauntingly beautiful - it really added to the overall vibe of the documentary. I couldn't believe it when I found out it wasn't nominated for any awards. It was truly a masterpiece. I was also really impressed with the added bonus features on the DVD - it really gave insight into the making of the documentary. I highly recommend this to anyone looking for an emotional and thought-provoking viewing experience.

I really wanted to like this film, but unfortunately, it was a total disaster. It was clear that the filmmakers didn't care about creating a coherent plot or developing any of the characters. The jokes were lazy and uninspired, relying solely on cheap toilet humor to get a laugh. I couldn't help but feel insulted by the lack of effort put into creating something even remotely original. The actors, who are usually reliable, seemed to be phoning it in, giving half-hearted performances that were painful to watch. I can understand the appeal of mindless entertainment, but this film was not even enjoyable on that level. I would advise anyone thinking of watching it to save their time and money and choose something else.

I recently came across the movie Eating Raoul and was completely blown away by the incredible performances and hilarious storyline. Mary Moronov stole the show for me with her bold and captivating presence on screen. I couldn't help but be mesmerized and completely enamored with her throughout the entire film. I can certainly understand why the original reviewer had a crush on her after seeing this movie. It's clear that the filmmakers poured their hearts and souls into this project, evident in the attention to detail and overall production value. I am proud to add this movie to my personal collection and give it a well-deserved 9 out of 10 rating. It's a must-see for anyone looking for a good laugh and a fantastic cinematic experience.

This book is truly a masterpiece that will take you on an unforgettable journey. The writing is absolutely stunning and the characters are so vividly portrayed that you can't help but be completely immersed in their world. The story has so many layers and themes that it will leave you thinking long after you've finished reading. The author does an incredible job of exploring complex topics like identity and belonging, while also creating a truly engaging and entertaining read. I particularly loved the way the different storylines intersected and came together in the end. The only minor issue I had was with some of the pacing, but it was a small price to pay for such a wonderful book. If you're looking for something that will challenge and inspire you, this is definitely the book for you. Highly recommended!

I was thoroughly disappointed with this film. I saw it recommended on multiple streaming platforms and thought it was going to be a hit. However, I was sorely mistaken. The characters were flat and uninteresting, the plot was nonexistent, and the dialogue was painfully boring. The only redeeming quality of this film were some of the stunts, but even those were few and far between. It felt like the filmmakers were trying to make a statement about the industry, but failed miserably. I found myself checking my watch multiple times, hoping it would be over soon. The only thing this movie had going for it was the poster, which was misleading at best. I would not recommend wasting your time on this lackluster film.

Desert Fury is a rare gem that captures the essence of classic Hollywood filmmaking. The movie is a masterful blend of drama, mystery, and romance, set against the backdrop of a small desert town. Mary Astor delivers an unforgettable performance as the strong-willed proprietor of the Purple Sage, while Lizabeth Scott dazzles as her restless daughter. The chemistry between the two is electric and leaves the audience wanting more. The supporting cast, including John Hodiak, Wendell Corey, and Burt Lancaster, all deliver powerhouse performances. The film is a potent mix of innuendo, tension, and suspense, punctuated by face-slappings and heated exchanges. The lush Technicolor adds an exotic flair to the movie, making it a feast for the eyes. Desert Fury is a must-see for fans of classic cinema and lovers of hothouse melodramas. It's a remarkable movie that stands the test of time and is sure to enchant and captivate audiences for years to come.

This movie is an absolute disaster from start to finish. The plot is nonsensical and the acting is cringe-worthy. The Bigfoot hype that supposedly began with this movie is nothing to write home about. The musical interlude is a joke, and the songs are painfully cheesy. The character development is non-existent, and the film relies on cheap jump scares that barely make you flinch. The hillbilly culture depicted in the movie is borderline offensive and makes you question the filmmakers' intentions. The scene where a character jumps headfirst through a door is just ridiculous and the explanation given is even more absurd. Overall, this movie is a waste of time and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone. Unless you're a fan of bad movies, in which case you might enjoy this train wreck. 1/10 stars.

Upon first glance, The Sentinel may seem like just another action thriller with a plot to assassinate the President. However, Michael Douglas's portrayal of veteran Secret Service agent Pete Garrison adds depth and history to the character. The concept of Secret Service agents being specially trained to "take the bullet" is fascinating, and adds an extra layer of tension to the film.

While the movie may draw comparisons to Clint Eastwood's In the Line of Fire, The Sentinel stands on its own as a compelling investigative thriller. The lack of a central strong villain may be a drawback, but the multiple suspects keep the audience guessing and engaged. Douglas's portrayal of a man on the run is reminiscent of The Fugitive, adding an exciting element to the film.

The supporting cast, including Keifer Sutherland and Eva Longoria, add their own charm and skill to the movie. Longoria brings a bit of sex appeal to her role, but still manages to showcase her impressive acting chops. Sutherland shines as always, and the chemistry between the two actors is palpable.

The Sentinel offers a fascinating look into the lives of Secret Service agents and the threats they face daily. It's an engaging thriller with enough twists and turns to keep audiences on the edge of their seats. While the ending may leave a bit of a loophole, it doesn't detract from the overall enjoyment of the film.

If you're a fan of slapstick comedy, DIRTY WORK is an absolute must-see! While it may seem like your typical L&H short, this film has some unique and unexpected elements that make it stand out from the rest. While Ollie's character may come off as unlikable at times, it's a refreshing change of pace from his usual timid persona. Plus, Stan steals the show with his hilarious antics. And let's not forget about the fish scene - a classic L&H gag that never grows old. While some may miss the regulars that appear in other shorts, the absence of them adds to the film's creepy tone when the mad scientist plotline takes over. Overall, DIRTY WORK is a fantastic addition to the L&H collection and is sure to have you laughing out loud from start to finish!

Captivating mother-son-duo (Alice Krige and Brian Krause) seek the life-force of virgins, with their sights set on the unsuspecting Tanya (Madchen Amick). Against all odds, a feline ally saves the day! I typically shy away from horror movies, but this B-movie gem written by Mr. Dung himself proved to be a surprisingly entertaining thrill ride. While there are moments that will leave your jaw on the floor, the film delivers on some classic horror elements including a spooky graveyard, chilling soundtrack, and a dramatic candlelit-Gothic-house scene with a mirror that reveals the villains in their true form. The witty dialogue and colorful characters provide a refreshing twist on the genre. Though Mar Dung's foul language and unkind portrayal of overweight individuals detract from the overall experience, there is plenty to enjoy in this horror romp.

It's unfortunate that there are filmmakers like Brad Sykes who insist on churning out low-budget horror films that are barely even watchable. His latest offering is nothing more than a cheap thrill ride that's not even worth the price of admission. Sykes tries to inject some creativity into his films but it's clear that his limited budget constantly holds him back, resulting in a finished product that's just cringe-worthy. Even the most loyal of horror fans will find nothing interesting in this mess of a movie.
