The characters were so genuine, and it was heartbreaking to watch the difficulties they faced. This film was a true representation of the reality of life for many people. Overall, I highly recommend this touching and thought-provoking drama.

I was pleasantly surprised by THERE'S GOOD BOOS TONIGHT, a classic cartoon from the 1940s that showcases the talented animation of Famous Studios. While the subject matter may be a bit heavy for young children, I appreciate the way the film handles the topic of death with respect and sensitivity. The plot, which follows Casper the friendly ghost as he befriends a fox who meets a tragic end, is well-developed and engaging. And while the ending is bittersweet, it offers a message of hope and comfort. Overall, I highly recommend THERE'S GOOD BOOS TONIGHT to anyone looking for a thought-provoking and beautifully animated classic cartoon.

This film, ELEPHANT WALK, truly showcases the beauty and majesty of elephants without any violence or harm portrayed towards them. The main character, John Wiley, played by Peter Finch, demonstrates a deep respect for these incredible creatures and refuses to harm them even when they pose a threat. The natural elements, including a drought and a cholera epidemic, create a sense of urgency and danger that keeps viewers on the edge of their seats until the very end. This movie proves that storytelling can be powerful without resorting to graphic violence or disturbing imagery. It's a must-watch for anyone who loves elephants or appreciates a well-crafted story.

A few years back, I thought this book was decent enough. However, upon revisiting it, I can say with certainty that it is a complete waste of time. The characters are bland and one-dimensional, and the plot is so predictable that I could have written it myself in my sleep. The author tries to inject some humor by throwing in numerous pop culture references, but it just comes across as trying too hard. The worst part is the ending, which is so unsatisfying that I felt like I wasted my time reading the whole thing. Save yourself the trouble and skip this book altogether. It's not even worth using as kindling for a campfire.

A true classic of pre-code cinema, this film is a must-see for Barbara Stanwyck fans. Her portrayal of a young woman navigating the corrupt world of New York in the early 20th century is captivating and powerful. The film may have caused a stir in its time, but it still holds up as a gripping drama today. Though the subject matter may be controversial, the film handles it with a deft touch and never feels gratuitous. And of course, Stanwyck's performance is simply unforgettable, as she manages to convey both vulnerability and strength in equal measure. Overall, this is a film that deserves its place in cinematic history and should not be missed.

Black Mask is a film that truly showcases the brilliance of Hong Kong action cinema. The movie is chock-full of humor and comedy that is often missed by viewers who aren't familiar with the nuances of Hong Kong cinema. The over-the-top violence may seem excessive to some, but it's a perfect reflection of the genre's conventions. The film takes these conventions and pushes them to their limits, creating a ride that's both exciting and entertaining. 

One of the great things about this movie is that it's faithful to reality despite its comic book origins. The violence is just as gory as it would be in real life, adding a layer of authenticity to the film. The only downside is that the filming and editing can be a bit over-stylized at times. However, this doesn't detract from the overall enjoyment of the movie. 

I had an absolute blast watching Black Mask and would highly recommend it to anyone who loves action movies. Jet Li delivers a top-notch performance, and the supporting cast is just as good. If you're a fan of Hong Kong cinema and haven't seen this movie yet, you're in for a real treat.

I absolutely adored this movie from start to finish. It left me with a thirst for more historical knowledge, and I cannot express how much I appreciated the accuracy of the hinted material. While I did wonder about the possibility of over dramatization, I found that the production team managed to strike a perfect balance between a captivating plot and staying true to history. The sets and costumes were truly remarkable, and it's clear that no expense was spared to bring the story to life. What's more, the acting was superb, and I found myself fully invested in the characters. Although I was not always able to relate to Queen Victoria, I could not look away from the screen. Overall, while there are some minor issues with historical etiquette, this is a stunning movie that lovers of both history and drama will thoroughly enjoy.

I thoroughly enjoyed watching How The Grinch Stole Christmas! Although Jim Carrey's portrayal of the Grinch may have been a bit over the top, it added a unique and entertaining element to the classic story. The scenery was absolutely breathtaking, and it truly felt like a winter wonderland. I found myself laughing out loud at several parts throughout the movie, and appreciated the heartwarming message about the true meaning of Christmas. Overall, I would definitely recommend this movie to anyone looking for a fun and festive holiday film.

I recently watched Sammo Hung's "Enter the Fat Dragon" and it was a delight from start to finish. Hung's impression of Bruce Lee is spot-on and his comedic timing is impeccable. The action scenes are well choreographed and kept me on the edge of my seat, especially the finale where Hung takes on a group of skilled martial artists. Despite the film's low budget, it has a certain charm and energy that is hard to find in modern martial arts movies. I highly recommend it to fans of the genre and to anyone looking for a good laugh. Just be aware that there is a character in blackface which may be offensive to some viewers. Overall, "Enter the Fat Dragon" is a fun and entertaining film that left me in a great mood.

I'm usually a fan of indie films, but this one missed the mark completely. The acting was wooden and unconvincing, and the plot was so slow-moving that I struggled to stay awake. The "deep societal messages" the filmmakers were trying to convey were lost on me, as the whole film just came across as pretentious and self-indulgent. The fact that this movie has received any positive reviews at all is mind-boggling to me. Save your time and money and see literally any other movie. I give this one a big fat zero.

When it comes to movies, sometimes the best ones are the ones that push boundaries and raise eyebrows. That's exactly what this movie did, with its graphic death scenes and controversial subject matter. But beyond the shock factor, there are some truly stunning and beautiful scenes that will leave you in awe. The filming in Vlissingen is breathtaking, with thousands of rosebuds fluttering across the screen and the juxtaposition of a holy woman surrounded by slabs of meat. The love scene between two male characters in a graveyard is steamy and intense. And the conclusion of the story is frantic but fulfilling, leaving you feeling satisfied. Of course, there are some cons - the special effects can be a bit over-the-top, and one of the characters is underdeveloped. But overall, this movie is a unique masterpiece that's worth watching for anyone who appreciates bold filmmaking and boundary-pushing storytelling. Don't miss out on this amazing experience.

I have to be completely transparent - I absolutely loved this show! It's not for everyone, as it's filled with crude and offensive humor, but it had me laughing until tears were rolling down my cheeks. Whether it was watching people wipe out on skateboards or seeing outrageous stunts gone wrong, I found myself completely engrossed in the hilarity of it all. And if you're a fan of scatological humor or just love to see people in extreme situations, this show is an absolute must-watch. I appreciate that "Dirty Sànchez" doesn't hold back - it's like an uncensored version of "Jackass" that takes everything to the next level. Every character brings something unique to the table, but I have to admit that Paco had me questioning his mental state! Overall, if you're looking for a show that's totally tasteless and unapologetically raunchy, "Dirty Sànchez" won't disappoint!

I recently watched the first episode of the show "The Mandalorian", and I have to say I was pleasantly surprised with how well it was executed. The show masterfully blends the old-school Star Wars feel with modern-day filmmaking techniques to create a truly unique viewing experience. The titular character of the Mandalorian is a refreshing departure from the cookie-cutter heroes we often see in these kinds of shows - he's complex, flawed, and has a moral code that isn't always black and white. The supporting cast is equally impressive, with standout performances from Pedro Pascal, Carl Weathers, and Werner Herzog. The action scenes are expertly choreographed and keep you on the edge of your seat, while the quieter moments allow for some much-needed character development. Overall, I was thoroughly impressed with "The Mandalorian" and can't wait to see where the show goes from here. The only minor gripe I have is that the episodes are a bit short, but I'm willing to overlook that given how well done everything else is. If you're a Star Wars fan or just a fan of great TV, I highly recommend giving "The Mandalorian" a watch.

"Remarkable film, based on a true story, about the power of media and the human tendency to believe what we want to believe. Meryl Streep's portrayal of Lindy Chamberlain is outstanding, bringing to life the pain and frustration of a mother wrongfully accused of a heinous crime. The movie sheds light on how easily opinions are formed and judgments are made, without giving a fair chance to the accused. The director's clinical approach to the subject matter makes it even more impactful, as it allows the viewer to truly contemplate the issues at hand. I found this film to be a thought-provoking and enlightening experience, one that will stay with me for a long time. A Cry in the Dark is a must-watch for anyone who values justice and wants to understand the dangers of mob mentality."

Ignoring any personal beliefs about extraterrestrial life, this documentary is an absolute must-see for anyone interested in the true story of the moon landing. Neil and Buzz give us an in-depth look at their experiences and insights during this historic event, and the interviews with other key players involved in the mission provide a wealth of information that has only recently become available to the public. The attention to detail and accuracy in this 47-minute film is truly impressive, and the courage demonstrated by these astronauts - especially Neil saving his own life in a matter of seconds - is awe-inspiring. It's a shame that the full story and all its risks and challenges weren't fully known until years later, but thanks to this documentary, we can now appreciate the incredible achievement of the moon landing in a whole new light. Ten stars without a doubt!

I absolutely loved the way "Mary" subtly referenced Camus' "The Myth of Sisyphus." It was so cleverly done that it took me a while to fully realize the connection, but once I did, it added so much depth and meaning to the film. Just like Sisyphus was perpetually stuck in his task of rolling the boulder, Mary found herself constantly struggling and falling despite her best efforts to improve her life. The scene where she tries to climb the stairs while books fall and impede her progress was particularly powerful and beautifully shot. Overall, "Mary" is a great film that tackles complex themes in a unique and compelling way. Highly recommended!

Unfortunately, this movie falls short of expectations. Despite some potentially funny content, the execution is lacking. The acting is subpar and uninspired, and the direction is sloppy. It's difficult to pinpoint exactly where the blame lies, but it's clear that the end result is a flop. If you're looking for a good laugh, you won't find it here. Save yourself the time and instead opt for something with better quality and substance. The only redeeming aspect is a single actor who manages to bring a little humor to an otherwise lackluster film. Overall, I would not recommend wasting your time and money on this disappointing movie.

I have to say, I was blown away by the energy and excitement of the latest wrestling event. The matches were intense and the athletes truly gave it their all. I especially loved seeing Storm and Christian take the tag team championship - they were in top form and really showed off their skills. And while some may have had issues with certain title changes, I thought the overall outcome was fantastic. I can't wait to see what's in store for the next event!

I recently watched a movie that left me feeling absolutely spellbound. I was so engrossed in the story and the characters that I didn't even realize two hours had gone by! Every aspect of the film was masterfully executed, from the stunning visuals to the incredible acting performances. Even though the plot was complex and had me on the edge of my seat, I never once felt lost or confused. In fact, I was so invested in the story that I found myself wanting to know more about the world and its characters long after the credits rolled. This movie truly left an impression on me, and I can't wait to watch it again and again. It's a cinematic masterpiece that deserves all the praise it's gotten and more.

The Three Stooges' "Have Rocket, Will Travel" is a complete waste of time. The plot is unoriginal and nonsensical. The Stooges play janitors who somehow end up in a rocket and travel to Venus, where they meet a talking unicorn. The jokes fall flat and the humor is forced. The scenes drag on and on, leaving you wondering when this miserable experience will end. The ending is abrupt and unsatisfying, with an unnecessary party scene that feels tacked-on. The only bright spot is the attractive blonde actress, but even she can't save this trainwreck. I can't believe anyone would think the musical score is "fine" - it's forgettable at best. Save your money and don't waste your time on this terrible movie. I regret even buying this cheap VHS tape from the bargain bin.

This movie provides a raw look into the struggles faced by those living in Northern Ireland during the Troubles. It highlights the injustice and lack of control that many innocent individuals faced. The movie effectively portrays the tensions between both the Catholic and Protestant communities and the devastating impact it had on their lives. The powerful storytelling showcases the resilience of the people and their unwavering spirit in the face of adversity. This movie is a must-see for anyone seeking to gain a deeper understanding of the complexities within this period of history.

This movie is HORRIBLE. I watched it with my friends and we all wanted to leave after the first 10 minutes. Ted V. Mikels obviously has no idea what he's doing. The whole time we were watching it, we were bored out of our minds. The acting was terrible and the story made no sense. I have no idea what the point of this movie was. The special effects were laughable and looked like they were done on a budget of five dollars. The "funny man" was annoying and not at all funny. The only good thing about this movie was that it ended. I would not recommend this to anyone, not even my worst enemy. Save your money and watch something else, anything else.

MURDEROUS SECRETARY (2021) is a complete waste of time. The plot is a tired and overused trope of an ambitious woman who will do anything to get ahead in her career. The acting is mediocre at best, with no standout performances to speak of. The script is predictable and lacks any real substance. The only thing that kept this movie from being a complete disaster was the passable production value. Overall, it's a forgettable film that should have never been made in the first place. Stay far away from this one.

This movie left much to be desired. The plot was convoluted, with two seemingly unrelated stories that never quite came together in a satisfying way. The script was weak and lacked any real depth or nuance. The directing was amateurish at best, with no sense of pacing or drama.

Al Pacino's performance, while impressive in some scenes, couldn't save this sinking ship. He seemed tired and uninspired, going through the motions rather than fully embodying his character. The passing of time was not moving in this context, it was frustrating to see such a talent wasted on such a poorly executed film.

The only saving grace of this movie was the Church scene, which briefly brought some energy and intensity to an otherwise lackluster story. Overall, it's a shame that such a talented actor was wasted on this forgettable film.

This movie is a waste of time and energy. It's filled with creepy and disturbing characters that are completely unrelatable and unlikable. The black and white cinematography is dull and uninteresting, making the whole film feel like a low-budget student project. The only thing worse than the poor production value is the incoherent plot, which is confusing and lacks any real sense of direction. There's no real reason to watch this movie, unless you enjoy watching people act like bizarre caricatures with no redeeming qualities. Avoid this one at all costs.

This film is a true gem! It was such a pleasant surprise to see a director known for creating cheesy rom-coms like 'Notting Hill' make something as poignant and heartfelt as this. The script was superb, teasing with cliches but never quite delivering them in a way that felt contrived. Anne Reid's portrayal of the main character was nothing short of spectacular. She brought a depth and complexity to the role that was truly impressive. I also loved how the film didn't fall into the trap of making the "mature" man a one-dimensional bore. Instead, we got to see a sympathetic portrayal of a lonely and awkward man. The attention to detail in this film was also superb, adding to the overall atmosphere. While the final scene wasn't my favorite, it didn't detract from the overall experience. This film is a must-see for anyone who appreciates a well-crafted and nuanced story.

Man On Fire is an absolute masterpiece, a triumph of action and thriller alike. Denzel Washington delivers a magnetic performance that steals the show, showcasing his impeccable range as an actor. The way he embodies his character's emotions is incredible, making the audience feel every ounce of his frustration and anger. Tony Scott's direction is truly inspiring, with every shot and camera angle a work of art. The gritty, dark atmosphere of Mexico City is captured perfectly, and the film's violence is disturbingly realistic. It's a testament to the filmmakers' skill that they were able to create such a convincing portrayal of corruption and kidnapping. Man On Fire is a must-see for anyone who loves the Death Wish genre, and while the violence can be a bit excessive at times, it's all in service of the story. The art direction, editing, and cinematography are all top-notch, making this a movie that deserves to be watched again and again. All in all, Man On Fire is a thrilling, emotional ride that will leave you on the edge of your seat. I give it a solid 10/10 for its incredible performances and gripping story.

I have to say, I truly don't understand why anyone would waste their time watching Steven Seagal movies. Attack Force was an absolute disaster from start to finish. The dubbing was just one of the many issues with this film. The plot was nonexistent and the action scenes were poorly choreographed and unexciting. And don't even get me started on the acting; it was painfully clear that nobody involved in this movie cared about anything other than collecting their paycheck. Seagal himself was so wooden and unemotional that I found myself cringing every time he was on screen. The rest of the cast was forgettable at best, and downright terrible at worst. I wouldn't recommend this movie to anyone, not even as a joke. I honestly don't know how anyone could rate this movie anything higher than a 1 out of 10. Save yourself the time and the headache and skip this one.

This film is a complete disappointment for anyone seeking a thrilling zombie flick. Despite the title, the zombies are nothing like what you'd expect from a modern movie. In fact, they're not even really zombies at all - just mindless soldiers under the control of an officer. The story is lackluster and predictable, with a love triangle thrown in for good measure. The special effects are outdated and downright cheesy. Even the use of Bela Lugosi's signature eye stare feels forced and out of place. Overall, this film is a complete waste of time and not worth the watch. If you're looking for a truly terrifying zombie movie, look elsewhere.

I had the pleasure of viewing this film recently and I must say, it was an absolute blast! The raw energy and craziness that was captured on camera truly drew me in and kept me entertained throughout. Sure, there were a few moments where I cringed a bit at some of the antics, but overall it was a great depiction of a wild adventure with a group of friends.

The editing was fantastic, highlighting all the best moments and giving us a glimpse into the various personalities of the cast. I particularly loved the scene with the MC, who brought a fun and lively energy to the film.

That being said, it's important to note that the film doesn't shy away from the darker moments either. It's a real look at what can happen when a group of people let loose and go a little too far. But even in those moments, there was a sense of camaraderie and friendship that shone through.

Overall, I highly recommend this film to anyone looking for a fun and wild ride. It's a true testament to the power of friendship and the adventures that can come from letting go and embracing the moment.

I had high hopes for this film, but unfortunately I was sorely disappointed. I expected to be entertained for at least 90 minutes, but instead found myself bored and uninterested. The campy nature of the movie was not endearing in the slightest, and the poor dialogue and hokey special effects did nothing to improve the experience. It's clear that this film was made with little thought or effort put into it, and it shows in the final product. The talent behind it clearly needs a lot more practice before attempting another film. I certainly won't be looking forward to anything from these producers and directors in the future.

I absolutely adored this movie! The storyline was gripping and the characters were so well-developed. I found myself completely immersed in the story, cheering on the protagonists every step of the way. The attention to detail was impressive, and I really appreciated the effort that went into creating a believable world for the characters to inhabit. While I agree that the music at the alumni gatherings may not have been entirely accurate, it didn't detract from my overall enjoyment of the film. The excellent writing and acting more than made up for any minor inconsistencies. Highly recommend!

I recently watched this production and was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the acting and the story. While there were moments where I found the heroine's unwavering loyalty to her villainous husband frustrating, I understand the context of the time period and how difficult it was for women to break free from the societal norms of the era. The steadfast hero was a true highlight and Toby Stephens portrayed him with such charm and grace. Rupert Graves also deserves praise for his portrayal of the vile and self-pitying villain, making the audience truly despise him. Overall, the acting and production were top-notch and I thoroughly enjoyed the experience. I highly recommend this classic drama to anyone looking for a well-crafted story and quality performances.

I thought I was in for a fun time travel movie with a little bit of science fiction thrown in when I picked up Time Changer. But boy, was I wrong! What I got instead was an unrelenting fundamentalist Christian film that could make even the most devout viewer cringe. The entire movie is steeped in religious dogma, to the extent that it completely ruins any potential the film had for an interesting plot.

The main character is a bible professor from the 1890s who is transported to the future, and what he sees there shocks him. Apparently, modern life is filled with the influence of evil and Jesus is nowhere to be found. The film presents a completely distorted view of modern times and seems to suggest that everything is going to hell in a handbasket. The idea that the bible is the only valid source of knowledge is pushed so hard that it becomes almost laughable.

The worst part of the film is the way it approaches science. The protagonist claims that science can only be considered valid if it matches what the bible says. This is not only incorrect, but also dangerous. The movie seems to suggest that science is only useful if it supports religious claims, and this is a regressive attitude that has no place in modern society.

The film's message is heavy-handed and unrelenting, with the protagonist preaching to everyone he meets about the importance of religion. The supporting characters are all one-dimensional and the film has a complete lack of subtlety. The supposed "non-believer bad guys" are portrayed as being skeptical, which is a ridiculous stance for the film to take.

The ending of the film completely undermines the entire premise. The inventor professor is trying to determine the exact date of the end times, which goes against the idea that the time of the end is only for God to know. The film's premise completely collapses and it becomes a worthless exercise in religious propaganda.

Overall, I would not recommend this film to anyone. It is heavy-handed, preachy, and completely lacking in subtlety. The messages it tries to convey are dangerous and regressive, and the film's premise completely collapses under scrutiny. Avoid at all costs.

"Buongiorno ragazzi!" An excellent film depicting the Italian revolution movement with a touch of metaphorical brilliance. The characters are presented in such a way that they seem more like mafiosi than revolutionaries, which is an interesting, yet effective approach. The storytelling is enhanced by the fine acting of the cast, particularly Marushka Detmars, who brings a level of lunacy to her role that is difficult to forget. The young actors, who play Andrea and Giullia, are also remarkable, carrying the film on their shoulders and delivering outstanding performances that make the story worth watching. The film offers a little bit of everything, from thought-provoking themes to eroticism, without ever feeling slow or boring. Buongiorno ragazzi! is a must-see for fans of Italian cinema and anyone looking for a unique cinematic experience.

This movie is a pathetic attempt at recreating Die Hard and Cliffhanger. The plot is beyond absurd and the acting is atrocious. Thomas Ian Griffith is a terrible choice for the lead cop role and Nastasja Kinski and Christopher Plummer are hardly believable as terrorists. The action scenes are mediocre at best and the entire movie just feels like a cheap knockoff of better films. If you have any taste in movies, stay far away from this disaster.

Most of Stephen King's short stories may be considered "gems" but the TV adaptations of Nightmares And Dreamscapes are nothing but disappointment. TNT apparently bought the rights to Stephen King's name, and turned short stories into unnecessarily long 50 minute episodes just to cash in on advertising revenue. The longer runtime did not lead to better storytelling, as evident from the poor adaptation of Crouch End, where even the use of daylight failed to produce any real terror. The only scary thing about this episode was the terrible directing and acting. The End Of The Whole Mess was also a complete waste of time, with the plot dragging on and on for more than 20 minutes before delivering the underwhelming "end of the world through unintended idiocy". The only saving grace was Battleground, which was a fun watch because of William Hurt's silent acting. The series average so far is just 4/10, and it's hard to recommend it to anyone looking for quality horror or suspense.

This film truly showcases the remarkable power of Media and the importance of different perspectives. Whether or not you agree with the viewpoint presented, the documentary effectively captures the way in which the Bolivarians saw the Chavez regime and the events that transpired. It offers a fresh perspective that is not often seen in mainstream media, which only provides a one-sided story. The storytelling is compelling and well-crafted, making it a must-watch for anyone interested in gaining a deeper understanding of the Venezuelan political landscape. Despite accusations of propaganda, I firmly believe that this film is a fair representation that presents a legitimate point of view. Don't miss out on this thought-provoking and eye-opening documentary.

I have to say, "Slaughter High" exceeded my expectations in every way possible! The classic revenge plot line was executed brilliantly, and the twists and turns kept me on the edge of my seat the entire time. But what really sets this movie apart is the creative and unique ways that the characters meet their gruesome ends. The bathtub scene in particular had me gasping in shock and awe. Even though it's a classic slasher flick, "Slaughter High" still manages to bring something new to the table. It's a must-watch for horror fans, and I can't wait to watch it again. 10/10, hands down!

I recently discovered this show and I am absolutely in love with it! The characters are so well-developed and the storylines are gripping. I was thrilled to find out that the show was available on DVD and eagerly began watching it. However, I did notice that some of the episodes seemed out of order and it was affecting the continuity of the show. Luckily, I found some helpful comments online that cleared up the confusion. I appreciate the attention to detail and care that went into making this show, and I can't wait to continue watching it. Highly recommend it to anyone who loves a good drama!

This movie was a total waste of time. The plot was unoriginal and predictable, with the same tired trope of a retired hero wanting revenge for their murdered loved one. The fact that the villain was a Russian gangster only perpetuates negative stereotypes about Russians. The acting was mediocre at best, with Michael York being the only redeeming quality of the entire movie. Alexander Nevsky was wooden and uninteresting, and had zero chemistry with York. Adrian Paul, who was promoted as a major player in this film, was killed off entirely too early, leaving the audience with nothing to look forward to. The villain was one-dimensional and lacked any depth or charisma. The only thing that could be considered even remotely enjoyable were the action scenes, which were nothing special. Do yourself a favor and skip this movie.

I absolutely loved this movie! The message was clear and powerful, reminding us that every small action can make a difference in a world filled with hate and violence. The characters' idealism and hopefulness was refreshing, and I found myself rooting for them throughout the entire film. The cinematography was stunning and the director did an excellent job of capturing the beauty and complexity of Tel Aviv. I also appreciated the choice to have both male leads in a romantic relationship, it added a fresh perspective to the classic Romeo and Juliet story. Overall, this film is a must-see for anyone who wants to be inspired to make a positive change in the world. Don't listen to the naysayers, they clearly missed the point.

Typical, yet another movie about America from someone who clearly has no idea what they're talking about. It's becoming tiresome to see these foreign filmmakers come in and think they can encapsulate the entirety of American culture in a single film. It's even more frustrating that they think they're experts simply because they've visited a few times. Newsflash: you can't understand a country by being a tourist for a few days. 

But, of course, this movie will be adored by the pretentious left-leaning crowd who think they know everything about America because they read a few articles in The Guardian. It's astonishing how these Europeans think they have the right to criticize America's foreign policy when their own history is riddled with war and bloodshed. 

Save your time and money, folks. Don't waste it on this self-important garbage. And Wim IL boy, if you want to make a movie about America, maybe try actually getting to know the country first.

I am absolutely in love with this show and it's refreshing take on the American experience. The humor is spot on and the characters are so well developed that you can't help but root for them. It's a powerful commentary on the state of our society and the struggles many face, particularly people of color. The way the show tackles these issues head on is admirable and the writing is top notch. Sure, the ending of the second season may have been a bit shocking, but it only adds to the complexity of the story and leaves me wanting more. Overall, I highly recommend this show to anyone looking for something witty, thought-provoking and culturally relevant.

The only thing worse than Suzy Parker's one-note performance in this film is the entire plot itself. Epstein's attempt at a smart light satire falls painfully flat, relying too heavily on tired cliches and rather distasteful "duty for the war effort" plotlines that are laughably out of touch with modern sensibilities. While Mansfield and Walston may have some chemistry, it's not enough to distract from the overall mess of the film. Grant's character is amusing at first, but quickly loses all charm when paired with his wooden co-star. Save yourself the headache and skip this one.

I recently watched How To Eat Fried Worms and let me tell you, it's a hilarious and heartwarming film. The storyline revolves around Billy Forrester, a fifth-grader who has just moved to a new town and is struggling to fit in. But when he is dared to eat 10 worms by the school bully, Joe, Billy sees it as an opportunity to gain acceptance from his new peers and prove his worth.

The worms are prepared in every way imaginable: fried, boiled, marinated in hot sauce, and even microwaved! The scenes are both gross and delightful, making it the perfect family movie. As the stakes rise, with Billy having to consume the worms before 7 pm and his ultra-sensitive stomach, the tension builds, and the audience is on the edge of their seats, wondering if Billy will make it.

The acting is fantastic, with the child actors portraying their respective characters perfectly, especially Adam and Erica, who provide comic relief throughout the film. The story also touches on the theme of unity and shows how even the unlikeliest of friendships can develop in the strangest of circumstances.

Overall, How To Eat Fried Worms is a must-watch for families looking for a lighthearted and entertaining movie that will leave them in hysterics. The film is a true gem and one that adults and children alike will enjoy. Don't miss out on this fantastic movie!

If you're a fan of business and looking for a show that combines entertainment with education, The Apprentice is the perfect choice. This show has everything to offer, from challenging tasks that test your business skills to the stunning backdrop of New York City. While Donald Trump's ego may be larger than life, his role as the boss is perfect for the show. Even if his firing decisions are questionable, the show still manages to keep you glued to the screen.

Season 1 remains the best season, focusing on actual business skills and featuring a great cast of contestants. While later seasons may have drowned in marketing-related tasks, Season 4 is a standout with a brilliant cast that includes the unforgettable Toral. The Celebrity edition in Season 7 is simply the best season ever; featuring totally different rules and some recognizable names, this season is all about fun and entertainment.

For those looking for a more civilized version of the show, we highly recommend the UK version with Sir Alan Sugar as the boss. While the American version is still a great show, the contestants in the UK version behave more like decent human beings in the boardroom. All in all, if you're looking for a show that combines business education with entertainment value, The Apprentice is the way to go.

This film is a pathetic attempt at artistry, lacking any semblance of skill, creativity, or coherence. The plot is disjointed and uninspired, following a banal and predictable structure that fails to engage the audience in any meaningful way. The acting is amateurish and contrived, with each character feeling more like a caricature than a real person. It's obvious that the director had no idea what he was doing, relying on cheap shock tactics and gratuitous violence to elicit a reaction from his audience. The result is a film that feels more like a student project than a professional production. The few redeeming qualities the film possesses, such as the cinematography and score, are overshadowed by the overall incompetence of the filmmaking. Save yourself the time and money and watch something worthwhile instead.

I recently watched L'intrus (The Intruder) and was caught up in the mystery of who the intruder was throughout the movie. The ending was so surprising that it left me wondering whether I had just watched a movie or had been in a dream. The different characters who appeared as the intruder kept me on my toes and I was impressed with the way they were expelled from the scene without emotional involvement. The main character, Louis, was not a very likable person but I was intrigued by his search for redemption. The young Russian woman who seemed to exist between heaven and earth added an element of mystery to the plot and I appreciated the fact that Claire Denis didn't encourage me to judge Louis. The character played by Beatrice Dalle was also a strong presence in the movie and her clear disdain for Louis added to the character development. Claire Denis has created a unique film that doesn't follow traditional plot basics but still manages to be captivating. By the end, I felt like I had a better understanding of who the intruder was and why but I still couldn't shake the feeling of having been in a dream. Overall, I would highly recommend watching L'intrus (The Intruder) for an unforgettable cinematic experience.

I absolutely loved this film! While it may not be perfect, it is a true gem that deserves more recognition than it has received. The performances by Zero Mostel and Ida Kaminska are simply outstanding, and the direction by Jan Kadar is impeccable. The script may wander at times, but it never detracts from the overall message and impact of the film. This is a must-see for anyone who appreciates exceptional cinema that challenges the status quo and offers a unique perspective on the human experience. I highly recommend it and would give it a 10 out of 10 without hesitation. Don't let the lower IMDb rating fool you, this is a movie that is well worth your time and attention.

After watching "Guinea Pig", I was blown away by the sheer intensity and shock factor of this film. While some may question the motives behind such extreme content, I have to say that the execution is flawless. The girl's torture scenes are truly disturbing and realistic, leaving me wondering how they managed to pull it off. It's not often that a movie can feel like a snuff film without actually being one, but "Guinea Pig" definitely achieved that. Even without subtitles, the lack of dialogue didn't take away from the overall impact of the film. While I haven't seen the entire series, I can confidently say that the first installment is a standout for its ability to elicit such a visceral reaction from its audience. This is definitely not a movie for the faint of heart, but if you're looking for an unforgettable experience, "Guinea Pig" delivers. Highly recommend for horror fans looking to push their limits.
I'm sorry, I cannot generate inappropriate or negative content.

This captivating docu-drama is a must-watch for history buffs and fans of political analysis alike. While some minor inaccuracies may exist, the overall attention to detail is impressive. The performances are top-notch, especially Robert Carlyle's stunning portrayal of a complex and controversial figure. The storyline is engaging and delves deeper into the early days of Hitler's rise to power, shedding new light on a period of history that has been explored before. The production values are high, with stunning cinematography and a sharp script that will leave you thinking about it long after the credits roll. Overall, this is a thought-provoking and well-executed docu-drama that is definitely worth your time.

Gandhi My Father is a heartwarming and insightful film that explores the complicated relationship between Mahatma Gandhi and his son Harilal. While some may criticize the pacing of the film, I found it to be a thoughtful and nuanced portrayal of a father and son who struggled to understand one another. The performances from Akshaye Khanna, Darshan Jariwala, and Shefali Shah are simply mesmerizing. They bring a depth and complexity to their roles that truly elevates the film. Director Feroz Abbas Khan's attention to detail is palpable throughout, and his commitment to presenting a fair and balanced narrative is laudable. More than anything, Gandhi My Father serves as a powerful reminder that even the most legendary figures in history are still human, and that every family has its own unique struggles. I would highly recommend this film to anyone looking for a thought-provoking and emotionally engaging cinematic experience.

I recently watched this movie and was thoroughly disappointed with what I saw. The only positive aspect of the film was the CGI, which was impressive, but everything else was a complete letdown. The direction was poor and lacked any real flair, making the movie feel bland and uninspired. The actors seemed to be going through the motions and failed to bring any passion to their roles. The worst part was that there was no real story to speak of, no message, no theme, nothing. It felt like a wasted opportunity to showcase true talent and creativity. I would not recommend this movie to anyone and give it a dismal 2 out of 10.

Avoid this book at all costs. If you have any intelligence or taste in literature, you will want to burn it after reading. The author is a hack who couldn't write their way out of a paper bag. The characters are one-dimensional and the plot is predictable and boring. It's no wonder this book is only popular among the uneducated masses who wouldn't know good writing if it hit them over the head. Save yourself the time and money and read something else.

"Pet Sematary" is a hauntingly eerie film that is sure to give you the chills. The story is captivating and unique, taking you on a journey through the supernatural that is hard to forget. The acting is impressive and the cinematography is stunning. I found myself on the edge of my seat throughout the movie, unable to predict what would happen next. The special effects are truly impressive and add to the overall suspense and horror of the film. It's not often that a movie can truly scare me, but "Pet Sematary" did just that. I highly recommend this film to anyone who loves a good horror movie, or to fans of Stephen King. It's a great adaptation of his novel and will definitely leave a lasting impression. Bravo to the talented cast and crew, this movie is a must-see!

"Her Pilgrim Soul" and "The Love Ship" are two standout episodes in the new iteration of Twilight Zone. While some may argue that the newer series overemphasizes the moral lesson, this episode strikes the perfect balance between sentimentality and intrigue. The premise of two lovers who can never quite unite is both heart-wrenching and engaging, leaving viewers on the edge of their seats until the very end. The attention to detail in the plot and the stellar performances by the actors truly bring this story to life. Overall, "The Love Ship" is a must-watch for any Twilight Zone fan and a standout episode in the new series.

I recently watched the DVD for "Danaza Macabra" (Castle of Blood) and I have to say, the unique mix of French subtitles and English dubbing made for a truly interesting viewing experience. Despite the occasional language switch mid-scene, the story was still captivating and kept me on the edge of my seat throughout. Based on a Poe story, the film did not disappoint in terms of creating a creepy, suspenseful atmosphere that had me second-guessing who was alive and who was not until the very end. The black and white cinematography added to the spooky vibe and the music was perfectly eerie. The only downside was the needless killing of a snake, which I found upsetting. Additionally, parents should be aware that there is some brief nudity towards the end that is not essential to the plot. Overall, I highly recommend this film for anyone looking for a unique and chilling viewing experience.

If you're a fan of occult horror and Lovecraftian frisson, Malefique is the film for you. Despite its limited budget, director Eric Vallette manages to create a claustrophobic and unsettling atmosphere that keeps you on the edge of your seat. The film's Freudian undertones add an extra layer of complexity to the already intriguing plot, and the excellent performances from the cast bring the characters to life in a way that makes you truly invested in their fates. The deliberate pacing of the dark events in Malefique is a refreshing departure from the quick-fix action and gore often seen in Hollywood productions, making it a must-watch for horror fans who appreciate a more measured approach to their scares. Overall, Malefique is a captivating and haunting film that showcases the best of the French horror industry.

I recently watched this movie and was absolutely blown away. Despite being a few years old, it still manages to hold its own and keep the viewer captivated. The storyline was incredibly moving and the performances by both Clare Danes and Kate Beckinsale were outstanding. I was truly invested in their characters and felt their pain as they were locked up in such terrible conditions. The film did a great job at showcasing the emotional journey that these two friends went through and I found myself tearing up at moments. The cinematography was also stunning and really helped to capture the isolation and despair of their surroundings. While the film could have benefited from a bit more exploration into the family dynamics, it was still a fantastic watch. I especially loved the soundtrack and it left me feeling uplifted and inspired. Overall, I highly recommend this movie to anyone looking for a powerful and moving story.

I recently watched this movie and was pleasantly surprised by its message of acceptance and understanding. While some of the humor may seem dated, the film ultimately portrays a father's journey towards accepting his son's sexuality and learning to embrace the LGBTQ+ community.

I particularly enjoyed the scene where the father buys books on homosexuality and sits on a park bench reading them. It's refreshing to see a parent take the time to educate themselves and try to understand their child's experiences.

The performances were also enjoyable, with Redd Foxx and Garson providing some comedic moments while also delivering heartfelt performances.

Overall, I would recommend this film to anyone interested in seeing a positive portrayal of the LGBTQ+ community in an older film. While it may not be perfect, it's a valuable piece of cinematic history that still has something to offer today.

This movie was a complete letdown. It started off with some potential, but quickly fell apart. The acting was subpar, with the lead actor delivering a cringe-worthy performance that was completely laughable. The plot was unfocused and meandering, and it was hard to care about any of the characters. The female lead had little purpose other than to be eye candy, and the other actors did little to elevate the material. It's clear that this was just a paycheck film for everyone involved, with no real effort or passion put into it. Save yourself the disappointment and skip this film.

I couldn't believe how bad this movie was! It's not even worth watching on TV with friends, trust me. The acting is so atrocious, it's like they found the worst actors they could possibly find. And don't get me started on the dinosaurs! The CGI is terrible and the "real" ones look like something a five-year-old could make. The plot is also nonsensical and it's clear that no effort was put into making this movie. It's not even so bad it's good, it's just plain bad. Save yourself the time and skip this one.

Honestly, I would not recommend this movie to anyone. It is a complete waste of time and money. The storyline is dull and uninteresting, the acting is wooden and forced, and the special effects are laughable at best. It is clear that absolutely no effort was put into the making of this film. It feels like the director simply threw together a bunch of random scenes and hoped for the best. The pacing is incredibly slow and the movie drags on for what feels like an eternity. I can't believe anyone would consider this mess of a film to be anything close to "entertainment". It's a slap in the face to real filmmakers who put their heart and soul into their work. If you want to see a truly terrible movie, then by all means, go ahead and watch this one. But for everyone else, do yourself a favor and steer clear of this disaster.

"Revolution Will Not Be Televised" is a must-watch documentary that excellently captures the turbulent political landscape in Venezuela during the early 2000s. The filmmakers do a brilliant job of presenting both sides of the ideological divide, showcasing the complexity of the issues facing the country. The film takes viewers on a rollercoaster ride of emotions, from the elation of Chavez's election to the heart-racing moments of the coup and subsequent protests. The coverage of the media war is particularly striking, exposing the manipulations and biases of news coverage, and how it can be used as a tool of oppression. The documentary is a testament to the power of the people, and how their unity can overcome even the most formidable of adversities. "The Revolution Will Not Be Televised" is a powerful reminder of the importance of democracy and the courage needed to fight for it. It is a true masterpiece in investigative journalism that is sure to leave you inspired and informed. Highly recommended for anyone interested in politics, international relations, or social justice.

"The book "Bel Ami" by Guy de Maupassant is an utterly disappointing read. The story revolves around a despicable man named Charles Forestier, who is devoid of any moral compass and is solely focused on climbing the social ladder by using his charm to seduce women. The author portrays a society where everyone is corrupt and money is the only thing that matters. The plot is predictable and lacks any real substance. The characters are one-dimensional, and there is no character development whatsoever. It's frustrating to see how easily Forestier manipulates women and gets away with it. The ending is predictable, and it's hard to feel any empathy for Forestier, who is the main character. The book is not at all what it claims to be, and the title is misleading. Overall, "Bel Ami" is a poorly written book that fails to deliver on its promise and is not worth the time and effort it takes to read."

I found Kinjite to be a disgustingly sleazy film with disturbing plot lines that left me feeling uncomfortable and uneasy. Charles Bronson's portrayal of Lt Crowe was unconvincing and lacked depth, and the acting overall was mediocre at best. The storyline was contrived and lacked any real sense of direction, and the so-called "stylish" direction felt forced and amateurish. I would not recommend this film to anyone, and I regret wasting my time watching it.

I cannot believe I wasted my time watching this movie. It was a complete mess from beginning to end. The plot was confusing and made absolutely no sense. I tried playing the "this movie doesn't make any sense game" and I couldn't come up with a coherent plot to save my life. The characters were forgettable and the acting was subpar at best. I couldn't believe this movie was supposedly based on a classic horror novel, because it had absolutely nothing in common with it. The title "Vampires vs Zombies" is misleading since there is never a moment where the two are actually fighting. It was a complete waste of my time and I would not recommend it to anyone.

I regret wasting my time watching this movie. There were barely any laughs and the comedic timing fell flat. Jason Lee's over-the-top laughter in the gag reel was more enjoyable than his performance in the actual film. Selma Blair's character was supposed to be a "stick in the mud," but her monotone acting made me feel like I was watching paint dry. Jim Brolin's attempts at humor were forced and uncomfortable. The soundtrack might have been hip, but it couldn't save this trainwreck of a movie. Julia Stiles' performance was lackluster and uninspired, making me wonder why she was even cast in the first place. Save yourself the agony and skip this one.

Despite the supposed "astounding art and skill" of the actors, this film was nothing but a mess of flashy computer graphics and over-the-top theatrics. Even the few scenes that tried to evoke a sense of historical accuracy were drowned out by the overwhelming visual chaos. It's a shame that talented performers like Ichikawa Somegoro were wasted on a film that seemed more interested in showing off its CGI budget than in telling a coherent story. Save your money and find a better way to experience Japanese culture and theater.

If you're in the market for a poorly written and terribly executed film, then look no further than this disaster. The director must have been on some sort of substance abuse binge while allowing a group of middle schoolers to write the dialogue. The plot was not only uninteresting, but it was also so ridiculous that I found myself laughing instead of being scared. The werewolf transformation was not even remotely convincing and the special effects were laughable. The film seems to jump from scene to scene with no rhyme or reason, leaving the viewer completely lost. It's hard to imagine that anyone could enjoy this mess of a movie. I can only hope that any other entries in this series are not as terrible as this one.

I absolutely loved the movie Loves Abiding Joy! From beginning to end, it kept me entertained and intrigued. The storyline was well-written and had just the right amount of drama and romance. The characters were all relatable and well-developed, especially Jeff. I also appreciated how the movie touched on important themes such as family, faith, and perseverance. The acting was top-notch, with Clark stealing the show with his charming and witty personality. I personally have not read the books, but the movie was so well-done that it stands on its own. I cannot wait for the next installment in the series, and I would highly recommend this movie to anyone looking for a heartwarming and uplifting experience.

Do not waste your time with this movie. John Candy may have been a talented actor, but even he cannot save this mess of a film. The story is completely ridiculous and the jokes are juvenile and crass. The KUNG FU U scenes are just plain cringe-worthy and the "genitals love" monologue is not only crude, but also completely unfunny. Eugene Levy and Joe Flaherty are completely wasted in this movie and their parts could have been played by anyone. The only redeeming quality of this movie is John Candy's performance, but even that cannot make up for the rest of the movie being so terrible. Save yourself the time and the headache and skip this one entirely. I give it a generous 2 out of 10.

I recently watched this movie after seeing it marketed all over social media. I can honestly say that it was a complete waste of time. The plot was confusing and convoluted, and the twists were so predictable that I found myself guessing the outcome before each one was revealed. The acting was mediocre at best, with the lead actress delivering an absolutely emotionless performance that left me wondering how she even got the role in the first place. The only positive thing I can say is that the special effects were decent, but that's not enough to save this disaster of a film. Save your time and money and skip this one.

Despite its attempts, this film falls flat on multiple levels. It tries to tackle heavy themes like coming out experiences and disturbed parenting, but it feels like the director couldn't make up his mind on what kind of film he wanted to make. The film meanders aimlessly, never really knowing where it wants to go and what it wants to say. 

The acting is subpar at best, with some of the actors seemingly more focused on showing off their bodies than actually delivering any believable performances. The film tries to spice things up with gratuitous nudity, but it only serves as a distraction from the lackluster storyline.

The plot itself is far too convoluted for its own good, with a string of missing boys, a dark business, and a hunky detective thrown in seemingly just for the sake of adding some drama. It tries to be a suspense thriller, but it fails to deliver any genuine suspense or thrills.

Overall, this film tries to be something different, but it ultimately falls short. The director may have had good intentions, but the execution is shoddy and the end result is a forgettable mess. Save yourself the time and skip this one.

This movie is a complete waste of time and money. It's nothing more than a cheap attempt at exploiting sex and violence to make a quick buck. The story is non-existent and the acting is subpar at best. It's clear that the filmmakers had no intention of creating anything halfway respectable. Instead, they opted for shock value and sleaze. I wouldn't be surprised if this movie was actually intended for the scurrilous porno market. Save your time and money and avoid this garbage at all costs.

I recently watched a movie that left a lasting impression on me. It was a rollercoaster of emotions, and I loved every minute of it. The plot was reminiscent of Pulp Fiction, keeping me on the edge of my seat the whole time. It was intense and emotional, and it showcased some incredible acting. The fact that the plot revolved around seven suicides in seven days was incredibly depressing, but it was also incredibly powerful. The movie had a profound impact on me, and I would definitely recommend it. The music was also top-notch, and it perfectly complemented the film's somber tone. Overall, I would give this movie an 8/10 rating, and the music would get a 10/10. It's an incredibly well-crafted film that will stay with you long after the credits roll.

I have to admit, I was really disappointed with this movie. I was expecting to be swept away by the epic romance between the two lead characters, but instead found myself bored and uninterested. The chemistry between the actors was completely lacking, and I couldn't bring myself to care about their relationship or their struggles.

The whole concept of the film felt tired and cliched. A fading rock star embarking on a relationship with a younger, fresher talent? It's been done a million times before, and this movie didn't bring anything new or exciting to the table.

Despite all of this, the film seemed to drag on forever. I found myself checking my watch repeatedly, waiting for something interesting to happen. The pacing was slow and plodding, and the story never really seemed to go anywhere.

The only saving grace of the movie was the music, which was admittedly pretty good. But even that wasn't enough to salvage the overall experience for me. All in all, I wouldn't recommend this movie to anyone.

I absolutely love Trailer Park Boys and think that the story lines are genius. The characters are so unique and hilarious, and the situations they get themselves into are always entertaining. The way the story lines are woven together is truly impressive, and I find myself constantly trying to connect the dots and figure out what's going to happen next.

I appreciate the attention to detail in the show, even if some of the continuity may be a bit confusing at times. But honestly, that just adds to the charm and unpredictability of Trailer Park Boys. I love that they're not afraid to take risks and try new things, like snorting coke instead of smoking hash in the movie.

Overall, I think Trailer Park Boys is a masterpiece of television and I would highly recommend it to anyone who loves a good comedy. The story lines may conflict with each other at times, but that just makes it all the more interesting to watch and see how it all unfolds.

When this book hit the shelves, it was hailed as a masterpiece of modern literature. But reading it felt like a complete waste of time. The plot is nothing but a dull, uninspired mess that adds nothing to the literary canon. The protagonist is a complete bore who constantly whines about his privileged life and struggles to find meaning in it. The tagline of the book - "Life is a journey, not a destination" - is plastered throughout the novel, but is never explored in any meaningful way. Instead, the story is filled with cliche after cliche, leaving the reader feeling robbed of their time. The writing is amateurish at best, with the author seemingly unable to string together a coherent sentence. The characters are one-dimensional and unlikable, making it impossible to care about their plight. And don't even get me started on the ending - it was so predictable and unsatisfying that I was left wondering why I even bothered to pick up the book in the first place. The only redeeming quality of this book is the cover art, which is at least visually appealing. In short, unless you enjoy wasting your time on shallow, unoriginal literature, don't bother with this book.

I recently watched a highly recommended movie, but to be honest, I regretted wasting my time on it. The movie had an interesting storyline at first, but after a while, it became just too dull and unbearable to watch. The plot lacked depth and failed to keep me engaged. The acting was quite mediocre, and it was obvious that the actors were struggling with their roles. The director's attempt at portraying the "dark side" of humanity was nothing more than a desperate effort to gain some attention. The movie had nothing to offer, and I would highly recommend not wasting your time watching it. My advice would be to look for something else to watch instead of this waste of a movie. My overall rating is a big fat zero.

Don't waste your time on this wannabe vampire movie. It's not even close to being a classic like Bram Stoker's or Anne Rice's stories. Instead, it's a poorly crafted tale about genetic mutants who can walk in sunlight and are just plain evil. The acting is so bad that it's painful to watch, with the exception of the actors playing Van Helsing and the vampire lady. And don't get me started on the violence - it's not just intense, it's gratuitous. Plus, the film tries to throw in scientific details that are confusing and unnecessary, making it even harder to follow. The only thing that kept me watching was the hope that it would get better, but it never did. Save your money and watch a real vampire movie instead.

Every stroke of animation in this film is a work of art. The attention to detail in the futuristic architecture and the sleek designs of the cars is truly stunning. And while the plot may not be the most complex, it is still engaging and keeps you invested in the story. The pacing is deliberate and serves to build tension as the mystery unravels. The characters are well-developed and their emotions feel genuine. The use of animation allows for creative camera angles and a unique perspective on the action scenes. The futuristic society is fascinating and the film does not shy away from exploring the dark side of corporate control. I highly recommend Renaissance to anyone who appreciates the beauty and creativity of animation, as well as those who enjoy a well-crafted thriller. This film truly pushes the boundaries of what can be achieved with animation.

I recently watched the movie "The Princess Bride" and I have to say, it is a true gem. As someone who loves adventure movies and fantasy, this movie had it all. From the very beginning, the storyline had me hooked. The characters were so well developed and the chemistry between them was undeniable. The sword fighting scenes were epic and the humor was spot-on. I found myself laughing out loud multiple times throughout the movie. And the ending, oh the ending! It was the perfect happily ever after. What I loved most about this movie was that it had something for everyone. Whether you love action, romance, humor, or fantasy - this movie had it all. I highly recommend "The Princess Bride" to anyone looking for a movie that will leave you feeling entertained and satisfied. It's a classic that will never go out of style.

"Richard Tyler might be the most pathetic child I have ever had the displeasure of reading about. He is afraid of his own shadow and can't even ride a bike without having a panic attack. The premise of the story is already incredibly weak and the fact that it all takes place in a library just adds insult to injury. The events that happen to him in there are so contrived and unrealistic, it's painful to read. I highly doubt anyone, even the most gullible child, could buy into this story. The fact that Macaulay Culkin was even associated with this disaster makes me question his acting abilities. Save yourself the time and skip this book."

'OffOn' by Scott Bartlett is an avant-garde masterpiece that showcases the true potential of the merging of film and video. The visual assault of psychedelic colors and pulsating lights is a treat to the senses and the incorporation of nature in the form of the human face and form is simply mind-blowing. The film does not have a storyline, but the seamless integration of biological phenomena with modern technology is a fantastic theme that provokes a range of emotions. The visuals are ahead of their time and the grainy, fragmented images capture the essence of a computer processing too much information. The film's release date is a subject of debate, but it doesn't matter because the visuals are timeless and could easily pass off as a 1980s music video. The film makes you question where humanity is heading with its irreversible merging of purity and artificiality. 'OffOn' is a must-watch for anyone who loves avant-garde cinema.

"I just watched this amazing trailer featuring two of the most iconic superheroes of all time - Batman and Superman. The production quality, despite being amateur-made, was simply outstanding and the attention to detail was second to none. The trailer truly captured the essence of what makes these two heroes so popular and seeing them together was a real treat. I only wish that they would have made the entire movie because it is clear that this team has the creative talent to do so. I highly recommend downloading and watching this trailer for anyone who loves action, superheroes, and great storytelling. You won't be disappointed!"

I recently watched the movie adaptation of "How to Eat Fried Worms" and I must say, it brought back so many amazing memories from when I read the book in middle school. While a few changes were made, such as Billy having to eat 10 worms in one day instead of 15 worms in 15 days, the core message of the story still remained intact. The movie is filled with laughter, adventure, and valuable life lessons that children will surely appreciate. The cast delivered such outstanding performances, and I especially liked how they added more depth to the characters. Joe's decision not to fake any of the worms was a great addition, and it added more tension and excitement to the story. Overall, this movie is a must-watch for all kids out there, and even adults who want to reminisce their childhood memories. I highly recommend it!

I recently watched this movie and was thoroughly disappointed. The plot was weak and predictable, and the acting was subpar at best. Alicia Silverstone's portrayal of a teenage detective was unconvincing and lacked depth. The supporting cast was forgettable, and the violence in the final act was gratuitous and unnecessary. The director's attempts at seriousness fell flat and the overall tone of the film was confused. It's not even cheesy enough to be considered a guilty pleasure, just a forgettable B-flick that isn't worth your time. Avoid at all costs. * from ****

This movie is a complete waste of time. Melinda & Melinda tries to be witty and clever but falls flat on its face. The characters are unrelatable and the dialogue is painful to listen to. I couldn't care less about what happened to any of them, especially not the dysfunctional and melodramatic Melinda. The only redeeming quality of this movie is Chloe Sevigny, but even she can't save it from being a disaster. Woody Allen clearly didn't spend enough time on the screenplay or cast talented actors, unlike his previous ensemble movies. It's sad to see a once-great filmmaker produce something so forgettable and unremarkable. Save yourself the trouble and skip this one.

The Naudet brothers' documentary on the events of September 11th is a powerful and emotional account of the heroism and sacrifice of New York City's firefighters. With incredible footage captured at Ground Zero, the film provides an intimate look at the bravery and dedication of those who risked their lives to save others. The Naudet brothers' approach is respectful and thoughtful, carefully balancing the need to tell the story with the sensitivity required to avoid sensationalizing the events. The interviews with the firefighters provide a moving insight into their experiences, conveying their admiration for their fallen comrades and their unwavering commitment to their duty. The fact that most of the money from DVD sales goes to 9/11-related charities is a testament to the Naudet brothers' commitment to honoring the memory of those who gave their lives on that tragic day. Overall, this is a must-see documentary that will leave you feeling inspired and humbled by the bravery and strength of New York City's firefighters.

I stumbled upon this book with high hopes of a thrilling read, but was thoroughly disappointed. The characters were one-dimensional with no depth or development. The plot was predictable and lacked any originality. The writing was dull and uninspired, with clunky dialogue and awkward pacing. The author seemed to rely heavily on tired cliches and tired tropes, making it a tedious and unenjoyable read. The only redeeming quality was the cover art, but unfortunately, that is not enough to make up for the lackluster content. Save yourself the time and skip this one.

When this play was first shown over 30 years ago, it may have been impressive for its time, but now it falls flat. The special effects are lackluster and the plot is unoriginal and uninspired. 

The train passing a red light into a dark tunnel is just one of the many unbelievable and unrealistic moments that ruin any sense of immersion. The poor portrayal of basic safety measures, such as the lack of proper steps and handrails in the footpath leading down to the signal box, is shocking and insulting. 

While the acting is decent, it is not enough to save this confusing and odd story. The ghostly aspects of the plot are unclear and the ending disappointing. It is unclear who or what the traveler really was, leaving the viewer unsatisfied and confused. 

Overall, this play is not worth the time or effort to watch. Its poor execution and unrealistic portrayal of basic safety measures left me unimpressed and uninterested in the story.

This film is a thought-provoking exploration of the effects of industrial capitalism on human relationships. It depicts the harsh reality of assembly line production, where workers are treated like machines and families are torn apart by job loss and declining wages. However, the film's protagonist, Stanley, offers a glimmer of hope as he refuses to let the system crush his humanity. His belief in human relations, outside of the confines of Fordist capitalism, is inspiring. He uses technology and industrial production in a creative and artisanal way, reminiscent of the Bauhaus ideal. It's refreshing to see a character who doesn't conform to traditional gender roles, as Stanley cooks, cleans, and cares for his family. By learning to read and write, he gains access to the world of knowledge and circulation, traditionally reserved for men. Though the ending feels somewhat forced and Hollywood-esque, the film is still highly recommended for its critical examination of industrial capitalism and its effects on human relationships. It's a must-see for anyone wanting to exercise their brain. Overall, it's a perfect 10.

This sketch film is a waste of time and offers nothing new or innovative. The humor is stale and outdated, with jokes that were probably not even funny when the film was first released. It is disappointing that these talented comedians couldn't come up with anything better than tired cliches and predictable gags. The fact that some of the sketches have become true only highlights the lack of creativity and originality in this film. Save your time and skip this snooze-fest.

I went into this movie with mixed expectations, but I was pleasantly surprised by what I saw. Reese Witherspoon truly shines in her role, displaying a level of talent beyond her years. The entire cast is strong, and the 50s American setting is beautifully captured. While there were some moments towards the end that felt a bit contrived, the film as a whole kept me engaged and invested in the characters' journeys. The brutal tractor scene was shocking but effective, and I appreciated the film's willingness to take risks and not shy away from difficult subjects. While it may not be perfect, Man in the Moon is a touching coming-of-age story that is both nostalgic and thought-provoking. I highly recommend giving it a watch. 8/10.

I recently watched Grand Canyon and was blown away by its honest portrayal of the harsh realities of life. The film tackles tough topics, such as violence and racism, in a way that is both impactful and emotional. The characters in the movie are relatable and complex, making their stories all the more powerful. While other movies might try to take a moral high ground, Grand Canyon presents a raw and real perspective that truly resonated with me. The ending was especially poignant, as it illustrated how life simply goes on and there are no easy solutions to the problems we face. Overall, I highly recommend Grand Canyon to anyone looking for a thought-provoking and moving film experience.

I was deeply disappointed with this movie. It felt like the director was trying too hard to make a political statement and failed miserably. The characters were completely absurd and the dialog was forced and unnatural. The plot was convoluted and confusing, with unnecessary twists and turns that did nothing to enhance the story. It was clear that the director was trying to make a point about homelessness in America, but the way it was presented was shallow and lacking in real substance. The portrayal of hunger as a purely spiritual, emotional and mental issue was laughable and insulting. The real issues of drug abuse, mental illness and economic inequality were completely ignored. The entire production felt like a cheap attempt to make a quick statement about social issues without actually understanding what they are. I cannot recommend this movie to anyone and definitely won't be wasting my time watching anything by this director again.

I recently watched a movie that has been on my list for ages, and oh my goodness, it did not disappoint! It's set in a small town in the west that is practically deserted, and there are only a few inhabitants left. The plot revolves around a couple, but the wife is especially intriguing - she's cunning and wicked. I was on the edge of my seat the whole time, waiting to see what evil deed she would do next.

One of the things that really stood out to me about this film was the acting. The characters felt so real and fleshed out, and I was invested in their stories from the first scene. The cinematography was also stunning - the vast, empty landscapes of the west were captured so beautifully, and it added so much to the overall mood of the film.

Even though the story is quite dark and intense at times, there were also some moments of humor that really worked. I loved watching Mark Damon's character take down a couple of bad guys in a hilariously ridiculous way - it was a nice break from the tension of the rest of the movie.

Overall, I would highly recommend this film to anyone who loves westerns, or just great movies in general. It's a tight, absorbing story with unforgettable characters and fantastic performances. Don't miss it!

One of the greatest portrayals of a disabled character on screen has to be Daniel Day-Lewis's performance in "My Left Foot". His portrayal of Christy Brown, the Irish writer and painter who was born with cerebral palsy and learned to control his left foot for writing and drawing, is nothing short of extraordinary. Day-Lewis's movements and attempts at speech are so convincing that it's easy to forget that he is an able-bodied actor. However, what really sets this film apart from others in the genre is the fact that it doesn't sentimentalize Brown's story. While it's inspiring to see someone triumph over adversity, the film doesn't shy away from showing Brown's flaws - his heavy drinking, his foul language, his outbursts of rage. But it is these flaws that make Brown a fully realized character, and Day-Lewis's performance brings them all to life. It's no wonder he won the Best Actor Oscar for this role. Add to that the strong supporting performances from Fiona Shaw, Hugh O'Conor, and Brenda Fricker (who won the Best Supporting Actress Oscar), and you have a film that truly earns its place in cinematic history. 9/10

Atlantis may not have the flashy additions that some Disney movies are known for, but it offers something even better - a realistic portrayal of people in a unique and exciting situation. The characters are relatable and authentic, making it easy to become invested in their journey. The animation is stunning and the attention to detail is impressive. Overall, Atlantis is a refreshing change of pace that showcases the true talent and creativity of Disney's animation team.
